discharge_summary: problem: high-risk burkitt-like lymphoma stage iv infiltration mo diagnosis 2020 right neck mass nasopharyngeal renal lesions, cervical lymph node biopsy 05/22: morphological and immunohistochemical picture of b-cell lymphoma, with small, intermediate-sized cells and high proliferative index. immunohistochemistry: positivity for cd20, pax5, weak cd10, bcl6. negativity for cd34, tdt, bcl2, cmyc, ki67 of 95 100%. cd3 evidenced the population of reactive t lymphocytes. cmyc negativity rules out the diagnosis of burkitt's lymphoma. the present case may correspond to burkittlike lymphoma with 11q aberration nasopharyngeal mass biopsy 05/26: b lymphoma with high mitotic index cerebrospinal fluid puncture 06/05: no bmo infiltration 06/03/2020: diffusely infiltrated by b lymphoma with high mitotic index. cd19 / cd 20 / cd10 / bcl 6 if de mo 06/04: cd 19 / cd 20 / cd10 / cd 43 / cd 81 / lambda collection of material for semen cryopreservation 06/05/2020 ecog 0. admission: 13/08/2020, discharge: 08/21/2020, stay: 07 d 22 h, location: ward, payer: sus. [person] diagnosed with Burkitt's lymphoma was admitted to the hospital for a second cycle of Rivac D1: 14/08/2020. On 08/16, D3 of the second Rivac, he had a fever peak of 38.1 °C, which lasted for about 1 hour. He reported nausea and had had 3 episodes of bowel movements with softer stools on the day in question. He also had a blood count on the day with 2,000 neutrophils, but already falling, with a tendency towards neutropenia. Given this, the condition was managed as febrile neutropenia, with a probable abdominal focus of infection. It was decided to start cefepime and metronidazole. He underwent a chest CT scan without changes, and a CT scan of the sinuses with evidence of content in the frontal sinus and mastoid. An endoscopic evaluation of the sinuses was performed by [organization], with no evidence of invasive fungal infection. remained on intravenous antibiotic therapy until 08/20, when antibiotic therapy was discussed with [organization], and it was decided to transition to oral clavulin ciprofloxacin. In addition to this, he underwent chemotherapy to date without other complications. He required a transfusion of 1 red blood cell concentrate on 08/19, without complications. Normal physical examination upon discharge. No procedures were performed. Diagnosis already established. 1. I provide folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet, to be taken on 09/01/20 to be taken 24 h after intrathecal chemotherapy 2. I prescribe amoxicillin clavulanate 875 125 mg and ciprofloxacin 500 mg, to be used every 12/12 h, until 8 am on 08/31 3. I prescribe filgrastim for use of 600 mg 2 ampoules in the morning and 300 mg 1 ampoule at night, via subcutaneous application, every day, until the follow-up appointment on 08/27 4. I prescribe prophylaxis: acyclovir 200 mg 2 tablets every 12/12 h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet every 12/12 h on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays omeprazole 20 mg 1 capsule on an empty stomach 5. I prescribe, for use in case of constipation and no bowel movement: lactulose syrup 15 ml every 8 hours, and bisacodyl 5 mg 1 tablet at night. 6. I prescribe ondansetron, in case of nausea or vomiting. 08/25 blood center transfusion room 08/27 outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 08/31 madit outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 09/15 [organization] safety follow-up appointment for clinical reevaluation and check PETCT scheduling counter 6 HC. Good.
question: ఇది సరైన రోగ నిర్ధారణేనా? రోగికి రెండు పూర్తిగా సంబంధం లేని అనారోగ్యాలు ఉన్నాయి.
answer: His condition is 'advanced Burkitt's lymphoma stage 4'. To be precise, 'CMYC negative Burkitt's lymphoma', which is very difficult to diagnose, and his case may be related to the '11q' abnormality associated with Burkitt's lymphoma.

question: ఉదరకుహర వ్యాధి మహిళల కంటే పురుషులలో ఎక్కువగా ఉంటుందా?
answer: రోగి అంటు వ్యాధితో మరియు 2000 న్యూట్రోఫిల్ లెక్కింపుతో హాజరయ్యాడు, ఇది న్యూట్రోపెనియాను సూచిస్తుంది. ఈ పరిస్థితిని ఫెబ్రిల్ న్యూట్రోపెనియా అని పిలుస్తారు.

question: నా భార్యకు యాంటీబయాటిక్స్ ఎందుకు అవసరం? అది ఆమె ఆరోగ్యానికి మంచిదేనా?
answer: మీరు 20/08 న ముక్కుకు సంబంధించిన యాంటీబయాటిక్స్ మొదలుపెట్టారు మరియు మీ చికిత్సను 31/08 న ఉదయం 8 గంటలకు అమోక్సిసిలిన్ క్లోబ్ నైట్రైట్ మరియు సెఫాలోస్పోరిన్ కోసం షెడ్యూల్ చేశారు.

discharge_summary: admission: 10/06/2020, discharge: 11/20/2020, stay: 01 m 13 d 19 h, location: ward, payer: sus. discharge report patient [person], 54 years old, single, from [address], receives retirement benefit, admitted to the emergency unit of [organization] on 10/06 with dyspnea 8 days after admission, fever not measured and cough with greenish sputum. on 10/08, he presented respiratory failure, requiring orotracheal intubation and high oxygen concentrations pao2/fio2 ratio: 104, with neuromuscular blockade for ventilation for sara. On 10/9, due to oliguria in the last 24 hours, however, maintaining a positive fluid balance, he was transferred to the semi-intensive care unit without the use of vasoactive drugs due to the hypothesis of nephrotoxicity. On 10/10, vasoactive drugs were restarted due to poor peripheral perfusion. Neuromuscular blockade with cisatracurium was suspended. [person] developed abdominal distension, with suspension of the diet. On 10/14, an abdominal ultrasound was performed with no signs of ascites or gaseous distension. On 10/15, sedation was suspended. On the same day, [person] presented with a deviation of the fixed gaze to the right, being evaluated by neurology and, after a computed tomography scan of the skull and electroencephalogram, without new alterations that would justify the condition, vitamin B1 replacement was indicated. On 10/19, a thoracic ultrasound was performed, showing evidence of pleural effusion on the left, measuring approximately 3.3 cm. Diagnostic thoracentesis was performed, with negative transudate culture and bacilloscopy, but with positive TBTRM on 10/22. At the time, a case of ICC was discussed, and as [person] did not present a picture suggestive of pulmonary tuberculosis upon admission, with no characteristic image, remaining afebrile throughout hospitalization, with progressive improvement of the pulmonary condition with Bactrim, in addition to 3 negative gastric lavage bacilloscopy samples in August of that year, it was decided not to isolate [person] and not to collect bacilloscopy again, since the diagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis was very unlikely. On 10/22, extubation was performed, without complications. On 10/23, [person] presented diarrhea, with liquid stools, no pathological products and no other systemic symptoms. On 10/25, he started a soft oral diet with good acceptance, and the nasogastric tube was removed and treatment for pleural tuberculosis was initiated by the attending medical team. On 10/26, [person] was admitted to a bed in the [organization] ward and, on 10/29, transferred to a bed in the [organization] ward, under the care of the infectious disease team. On 10/28, treatment for pneumocystosis with Bactrim D21/D21 was suspended and corticosteroid therapy was suspended, with Bactrim being resumed at a prophylactic dose for neurotoxoplasmosis and pneumocystosis. During hospitalization, [person] presented persistent thrombocytopenia while on prophylactic anticoagulation. Hematology assessed him and indicated the start of full-dose subcutaneous fondaparinoux 7.5 mg. On 11/3, with a platelet count above 150,000, dual anticoagulation with warfarin 5 mg/day was initiated. maintained until 11/08, with warfarin adjustment according to prothrombin time, due to anticoagulation for 4 weeks. In addition, [person] presented anemia probably secondary to azathioprine myelotoxicity and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 replacement was started, 1 vial of 5000 mcg 1x per week. Upon admission to the [organization] ward, it was decided to suspend the RIP regimen due to an acute clinical laboratory picture not compatible with pulmonary or pleural tuberculosis. [person] presented infectious urinalysis culture positive for Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase, but as he remained asymptomatic and with good renal function, it was decided not to treat it, considering contamination. [person] is currently fit for hospital discharge, being on room air, with no signs of discomfort, hemodynamically stable, not using vasoactive drugs, and with good acceptance of oral diet, assisted only by the risk of bronchoaspiration, with international normalized ratio in the range of 2.9 with 5 mg of warfarin/day. Current problem 1. Nosocomial pneumonia? Recent admission to [organization] 08/14 09/25 Community-acquired pneumonia treated with clavulin, pcp Presumed hepatotoxicity due to bactrin Nosocomial pneumonia treated with cefepime 2. Pneumocystosis? 3. Normochromic macrocytic anemia to be clarified secondary to bactrim? Secondary to zidovudine? 4. Thrombocytopenia to be clarified Thrombocytopenia induced by prophylactic heparin? Tests 1. Transthoracic echocardiography 08/17: cardiac chambers with normal dimensions. left ventricular systolic performance and segmental mobility were normal. 2. abdominal ultrasound 8/17: ultrasound signs that may correspond to liver disease, with no evidence of suspicious focal lesions. absence of free intra-abdominal fluid. problem: 1. human immunodeficiency virus c3 diagnosed in 2004 8/17: cd4 135/cv: undetectable 2. neurotoxoplasmosis with motor sequelae in the right upper limb 3. anti hcv / hcv pcr negative 4. neurological disorder to be clarified wernicke's encephalopathy? psychiatric disorder to be clarified 5. chronic liver disease diagnosed in 2016 6. presumed chronic obstructive pulmonary disease medications in use risperidone 2 mg at night warfarin 5 mg/day until 12/01 discontinue after antiretroviral therapy: tenofovir 300 mg lamivudine 300 mg 1 tablet early darunavir 600 mg 1 tablet 12/12h ritonavir 100 mg 1 tablet 12/12h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet 12/12h pcp prophylaxis and neurotoxicity folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet/day. no changes.. programming we consider anemia secondary to probable myelotoxicity due to antiretroviral therapy AZT being replaced by tenofovir on 11/09. I maintain prophylaxis for PCP and neurotox with Bactrim, maintain folinic acid replacement 15 mg/day until follow-up appointment, decided to suspend vitamin B12 replacement, given 2 recent dosages with normal vitamin B12, maintain anticoagulation with warfarin started on 11/03 for 4 weeks until 12/01. follow-up appointment to the outpatient clinic, request tests for follow-up appointment. Good.

answer: You were admitted to the hospital on June 10th due to respiratory distress and cough. On August 10th, your breathing improved, and you require an endotracheal tube.

question: కుక్క తన పరీక్ష పాజిటివ్ అని చెప్పింది, కానీ తరువాత ఫలితం నెగటివ్ అని చెప్పారు. కుక్క కూడా ఆకలితో ఉందని నేను అనుకుంటున్నాను.
answer: మీ పరీక్ష నివేదికలో మీకు టిబి పాజిటివ్ అని తేలింది. అయితే, క్లినికల్ ల్యాబొరేటరీ ఫలితాలు పల్మనరీ లేదా ప్లూరల్ టిబికి సరిపోలడం లేదు, మరియు లక్షణాలు 'సుప్త దశలో' ఉన్నాయి. కాబట్టి, చికిత్స ప్రారంభించి ఆపివేయబడింది.

question: Or is it not necessary for anyone other than us to use warfarin?
answer: ఆసుపత్రిలో ఉన్న సమయంలో, మీకు 'క్రానిక్ థ్రోంబోసైటోపెనియా' (ప్లేట్‌లెట్ లోపం) ఉన్నట్లు నిర్ధారణ అయింది. హెమటాలజీ బృందం మీకు తెలియజేసింది, చివరకు మీరు వార్ఫరిన్ తీసుకోవడం ప్రారంభించారు. మీరు 11/03 నుండి 12/01 వరకు 4 వారాల పాటు వార్ఫరిన్ తీసుకోవాలని చెప్పారు.

discharge_summary: admission: 10/06/2020, discharge: 11/20/2020, stay: 01 m 13 d 19 h, location: ward, payer: sus. discharge report patient [person], 54 years old, single, from [address], receives retirement benefit, admitted to the emergency unit of [organization] on 10/06 with dyspnea 8 days after admission, fever not measured and cough with greenish sputum. on 10/08, he presented respiratory failure, requiring orotracheal intubation and high oxygen concentrations pao2/fio2 ratio: 104, with neuromuscular blockade for ventilation for sara. On 10/9, due to oliguria in the last 24 hours, however, maintaining a positive fluid balance, he was transferred to the semi-intensive care unit without the use of vasoactive drugs due to the hypothesis of nephrotoxicity. On 10/10, vasoactive drugs were restarted due to poor peripheral perfusion. Neuromuscular blockade with cisatracurium was suspended. [person] developed abdominal distension, with suspension of the diet. On 10/14, an abdominal ultrasound was performed with no signs of ascites or gaseous distension. On 10/15, sedation was suspended. On the same day, [person] presented with a deviation of the fixed gaze to the right, being evaluated by neurology and, after a computed tomography scan of the skull and electroencephalogram, without new alterations that would justify the condition, vitamin B1 replacement was indicated. On 10/19, a thoracic ultrasound was performed, showing evidence of pleural effusion on the left, measuring approximately 3.3 cm. Diagnostic thoracentesis was performed, with negative transudate culture and bacilloscopy, but with positive TBTRM on 10/22. At the time, a case of ICC was discussed, and as [person] did not present a picture suggestive of pulmonary tuberculosis upon admission, with no characteristic image, remaining afebrile throughout hospitalization, with progressive improvement of the pulmonary condition with Bactrim, in addition to 3 negative gastric lavage bacilloscopy samples in August of that year, it was decided not to isolate [person] and not to collect bacilloscopy again, since the diagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis was very unlikely. On 10/22, extubation was performed, without complications. On 10/23, [person] presented diarrhea, with liquid stools, no pathological products and no other systemic symptoms. On 10/25, he started a soft oral diet with good acceptance, and the nasogastric tube was removed and treatment for pleural tuberculosis was initiated by the attending medical team. On 10/26, [person] was admitted to a bed in the [organization] ward and, on 10/29, transferred to a bed in the [organization] ward, under the care of the infectious disease team. On 10/28, treatment for pneumocystosis with Bactrim D21/D21 was suspended and corticosteroid therapy was suspended, with Bactrim being resumed at a prophylactic dose for neurotoxoplasmosis and pneumocystosis. During hospitalization, [person] presented persistent thrombocytopenia while on prophylactic anticoagulation. Hematology assessed him and indicated the start of full-dose subcutaneous fondaparinoux 7.5 mg. On 11/3, with a platelet count above 150,000, dual anticoagulation with warfarin 5 mg/day was initiated. maintained until 11/08, with warfarin adjustment according to prothrombin time, due to anticoagulation for 4 weeks. In addition, [person] presented anemia probably secondary to azathioprine myelotoxicity and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 replacement was started, 1 vial of 5000 mcg 1x per week. Upon admission to the [organization] ward, it was decided to suspend the RIP regimen due to an acute clinical laboratory picture not compatible with pulmonary or pleural tuberculosis. [person] presented infectious urinalysis culture positive for Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase, but as he remained asymptomatic and with good renal function, it was decided not to treat it, considering contamination. [person] is currently fit for hospital discharge, being on room air, with no signs of discomfort, hemodynamically stable, not using vasoactive drugs, and with good acceptance of oral diet, assisted only by the risk of bronchoaspiration, with international normalized ratio in the range of 2.9 with 5 mg of warfarin/day. Current problem 1. Nosocomial pneumonia? Recent admission to [organization] 08/14 09/25 Community-acquired pneumonia treated with clavulin, pcp Presumed hepatotoxicity due to bactrin Nosocomial pneumonia treated with cefepime 2. Pneumocystosis? 3. Normochromic macrocytic anemia to be clarified secondary to bactrim? Secondary to zidovudine? 4. Thrombocytopenia to be clarified Thrombocytopenia induced by prophylactic heparin? Tests 1. Transthoracic echocardiography 08/17: cardiac chambers with normal dimensions. left ventricular systolic performance and segmental mobility were normal. 2. abdominal ultrasound 8/17: ultrasound signs that may correspond to liver disease, with no evidence of suspicious focal lesions. absence of free intra-abdominal fluid. problem: 1. human immunodeficiency virus c3 diagnosed in 2004 8/17: cd4 135/cv: undetectable 2. neurotoxoplasmosis with motor sequelae in the right upper limb 3. anti hcv / hcv pcr negative 4. neurological disorder to be clarified wernicke's encephalopathy? psychiatric disorder to be clarified 5. chronic liver disease diagnosed in 2016 6. presumed chronic obstructive pulmonary disease medications in use risperidone 2 mg at night warfarin 5 mg/day until 12/01 discontinue after antiretroviral therapy: tenofovir 300 mg lamivudine 300 mg 1 tablet early darunavir 600 mg 1 tablet 12/12h ritonavir 100 mg 1 tablet 12/12h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet 12/12h pcp prophylaxis and neurotoxicity folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet/day. no changes.. programming we consider anemia secondary to probable myelotoxicity due to antiretroviral therapy AZT being replaced by tenofovir on 11/09. I maintain prophylaxis for PCP and neurotox with Bactrim, maintain folinic acid replacement 15 mg/day until follow-up appointment, decided to suspend vitamin B12 replacement, given 2 recent dosages with normal vitamin B12, maintain anticoagulation with warfarin started on 11/03 for 4 weeks until 12/01. follow-up appointment to the outpatient clinic, request tests for follow-up appointment. Good.
question: నా మనస్సు ఎక్కడికి పోయింది?
answer: అక్టోబర్ 15న, మిమ్మల్ని 'కుడి కంటి నొప్పి'తో ఆసుపత్రిలో చేర్చారు. ఒక న్యూరాలజిస్ట్ మిమ్మల్ని పరీక్షించి, మీ తలకు CT స్కాన్ చేసి, ఎలక్ట్రోఎన్సెఫలోగ్రామ్ తరువాత, 'కొత్త విషయాలు ఏమీ కనుగొనబడలేదు,' మరియు విటమిన్ B1 సప్లిమెంట్ తీసుకోవాలని సలహా ఇచ్చారు.

question: నా మూత్ర పరీక్ష ఫలితంలో బ్యాక్టీరియా ఉన్నట్లు వచ్చింది. దాని గురించి ఏదైనా చేయగలమా అని ఆలోచిస్తున్నారా?
answer: బాలుడి రక్త పరీక్షలో న్యుమోనియా సంకేతాలు కనిపించాయి, కానీ బాలుడికి ఎలాంటి లక్షణాలు లేవు, మరియు అతని క్రియేటినిన్ సాధారణంగా ఉంది. కాబట్టి, అతనికి ఇన్ఫెక్షన్ లేదని నిర్ణయించారు.

answer: You have also gone through Sulfamethoxandine, BCG Rock, and Neurotoxicity. 'Bacterial பாதி பிசிபி మరియు நரம்பியல் நச்சுத்தன்மை கட்டுப்பாடு' (Bacterial பாதி பிசிபி మరియు நரம்பியல் நச்சுத்தன்மை கட்டுப்பாடு) is planned.

discharge_summary: high-risk burkitt-like lymphoma stage iv infiltration mo diagnosis 2020 right neck mass nasopharyngeal renal lesions, cervical lymph node biopsy 05/22: morphological and immunohistochemical picture of b-cell lymphoma, with small, intermediate-sized cells and high proliferative index. immunohistochemistry: positivity for cd20, pax5, weak cd10, bcl6. negativity for cd34, tdt, bcl2, cmyc, ki67 of 95 100%. cd3 evidenced the population of reactive t lymphocytes. cmyc negativity rules out the diagnosis of burkitt's lymphoma. the present case may correspond to burkittlike lymphoma with 11q aberration nasopharyngeal mass biopsy 05/26: b lymphoma with high mitotic index cerebrospinal fluid puncture 06/05: no bmo infiltration 06/03/2020: diffusely infiltrated by b lymphoma with high mitotic index. cd19 / cd 20 / cd10 / bcl 6 if de mo 06/04: cd 19 / cd 20 / cd10 / cd 43 / cd 81 / lambda collection of material for semen cryopreservation 06/05/2020 ecog 0. admission: 13/08/2020, discharge: 08/21/2020, stay: 07 d 22 h, location: ward, payer: sus. [person] diagnosed with Burkitt's lymphoma was admitted to the hospital for a second cycle of Rivac D1: 14/08/2020. On 08/16, D3 of the second Rivac, he had a fever peak of 38.1 °C, which lasted for about 1 hour. He reported nausea and had had 3 episodes of bowel movements with softer stools on the day in question. He also had a blood count on the day with 2,000 neutrophils, but already falling, with a tendency towards neutropenia. Given this, the condition was managed as febrile neutropenia, with a probable abdominal focus of infection. It was decided to start cefepime and metronidazole. He underwent a chest CT scan without changes, and a CT scan of the sinuses with evidence of content in the frontal sinus and mastoid. An endoscopic evaluation of the sinuses was performed by [organization], with no evidence of invasive fungal infection. remained on intravenous antibiotic therapy until 08/20, when antibiotic therapy was discussed with [organization], and it was decided to transition to oral clavulin ciprofloxacin. In addition to this, he underwent chemotherapy to date without other complications. He required a transfusion of 1 red blood cell concentrate on 08/19, without complications. Normal physical examination upon discharge. No procedures were performed. Diagnosis already established. 1. I provide folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet, to be taken on 09/01/20 to be taken 24 h after intrathecal chemotherapy 2. I prescribe amoxicillin clavulanate 875 125 mg and ciprofloxacin 500 mg, to be used every 12/12 h, until 8 am on 08/31 3. I prescribe filgrastim for use of 600 mg 2 ampoules in the morning and 300 mg 1 ampoule at night, via subcutaneous application, every day, until the follow-up appointment on 08/27 4. I prescribe prophylaxis: acyclovir 200 mg 2 tablets every 12/12 h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet every 12/12 h on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays omeprazole 20 mg 1 capsule on an empty stomach 5. I prescribe, for use in case of constipation and no bowel movement: lactulose syrup 15 ml every 8 hours, and bisacodyl 5 mg 1 tablet at night. 6. I prescribe ondansetron, in case of nausea or vomiting. 08/25 blood center transfusion room 08/27 outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 08/31 madit outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 09/15 [organization] safety follow-up appointment for clinical reevaluation and check PETCT scheduling counter 6 HC. Good.

answer: The biopsy report showed a "negative" margin and showed "Reversible features of Burkitt's lymphoma" and "Reversible features of Burkitt's lymphoma."

discharge_summary: high-risk burkitt-like lymphoma stage iv infiltration mo diagnosis 2020 right neck mass nasopharyngeal renal lesions, cervical lymph node biopsy 05/22: morphological and immunohistochemical picture of b-cell lymphoma, with small, intermediate-sized cells and high proliferative index. immunohistochemistry: positivity for cd20, pax5, weak cd10, bcl6. negativity for cd34, tdt, bcl2, cmyc, ki67 of 95 100%. cd3 evidenced the population of reactive t lymphocytes. cmyc negativity rules out the diagnosis of burkitt's lymphoma. the present case may correspond to burkittlike lymphoma with 11q aberration nasopharyngeal mass biopsy 05/26: b lymphoma with high mitotic index cerebrospinal fluid puncture 06/05: no bmo infiltration 06/03/2020: diffusely infiltrated by b lymphoma with high mitotic index. cd19 / cd 20 / cd10 / bcl 6 if de mo 06/04: cd 19 / cd 20 / cd10 / cd 43 / cd 81 / lambda collection of material for semen cryopreservation 06/05/2020 ecog 0. admission: 13/08/2020, discharge: 08/21/2020, stay: 07 d 22 h, location: ward, payer: sus. [person] diagnosed with Burkitt's lymphoma was admitted to the hospital for a second cycle of Rivac D1: 14/08/2020. On 08/16, D3 of the second Rivac, he had a fever peak of 38.1 °C, which lasted for about 1 hour. He reported nausea and had had 3 episodes of bowel movements with softer stools on the day in question. He also had a blood count on the day with 2,000 neutrophils, but already falling, with a tendency towards neutropenia. Given this, the condition was managed as febrile neutropenia, with a probable abdominal focus of infection. It was decided to start cefepime and metronidazole. He underwent a chest CT scan without changes, and a CT scan of the sinuses with evidence of content in the frontal sinus and mastoid. An endoscopic evaluation of the sinuses was performed by [organization], with no evidence of invasive fungal infection. remained on intravenous antibiotic therapy until 08/20, when antibiotic therapy was discussed with [organization], and it was decided to transition to oral clavulin ciprofloxacin. In addition to this, he underwent chemotherapy to date without other complications. He required a transfusion of 1 red blood cell concentrate on 08/19, without complications. Normal physical examination upon discharge. No procedures were performed. Diagnosis already established. 1. I provide folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet, to be taken on 09/01/20 to be taken 24 h after intrathecal chemotherapy 2. I prescribe amoxicillin clavulanate 875 125 mg and ciprofloxacin 500 mg, to be used every 12/12 h, until 8 am on 08/31 3. I prescribe filgrastim for use of 600 mg 2 ampoules in the morning and 300 mg 1 ampoule at night, via subcutaneous application, every day, until the follow-up appointment on 08/27 4. I prescribe prophylaxis: acyclovir 200 mg 2 tablets every 12/12 h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet every 12/12 h on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays omeprazole 20 mg 1 capsule on an empty stomach 5. I prescribe, for use in case of constipation and no bowel movement: lactulose syrup 15 ml every 8 hours, and bisacodyl 5 mg 1 tablet at night. 6. I prescribe ondansetron, in case of nausea or vomiting. 08/25 blood center transfusion room 08/27 outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 08/31 madit outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 09/15 [organization] safety follow-up appointment for clinical reevaluation and check PETCT scheduling counter 6 HC. Good.

question: CT స్కాన్‌లో ఏమైనా కనిపిస్తుందా? నాకు ఏమైనా వ్యాధులు ఉన్నాయా?
answer: రక్త పరీక్షలలో ఎటువంటి మార్పులు లేవు, CT స్కాన్ ఫ్రంటల్ సైనస్ మరియు మాస్టాయిడ్ ఫ్లెక్సురా తగ్గినట్లు చూపించింది. ఎండోస్కోపిక్ పరీక్షలో ఇన్వాసివ్ ఫంగల్ ఇన్ఫెక్షన్ యొక్క సంకేతాలు ఏమీ కనిపించలేదు.

question: మీరు నాకు ఇంట్లో అన్ని మందులు (ఫ్లాగ్రిస్టిమ్, ఎస్కోలోవిర్, సల్ఫామెథోక్సజోల్) ఇచ్చారా?
answer: మీ 'ఫిల్గ్రిస్టిమ్...' ను ఆగష్టు 27 వరకు రోజువారీ ఉపయోగం కోసం ఇవ్వబడింది. మీకు 'ప్రోఫ్లెక్సీ: ఎసైక్లోవిర్... సులామెథోక్సజోల్ ట్రిమెథోప్రిమ్... ఒమెప్రజోల్' సూచించబడింది.

discharge_summary: 1. bloodstream infection associated with Schilley catheter in the right femoral vein sac 11/08 2. bacterial endocarditis associated with catheter echocardiogram 11/18: presence of vegetation in the mitral valve 3. pyogenic spondylodiscitis in l3/l4 11/05: low back pain, gait disturbance, computed tomography of the lumbosacral spine 11/12: findings suggestive of a fracture due to bone fragility of the vertebral body of l1, gas foci in the spinal canal at the level of l2l3 that may be related to an extruded disc herniation with degenerative disc disease, and an infectious or inflammatory process cannot be ruled out, lumbar magnetic resonance imaging 25/11/2020: infectious spondylodiscitis with anterior epidural abscess 4. left ileopsoas abscess, magnetic resonance imaging 25/10/2020: intramuscular collection in the ileopsoas left 15 x 2.1 x 1.8 cm with edema and adjacent post-contrast enhancement. admission: 11/08/2020, discharge: 01/02/2021, stay: 01 m 24 d 15 h, location: ward: ward payer: sus. [person] attends hemodialysis session with severe left lower back pain that had started 3 days ago, associated with asthenia, and altered gait. [person] who was accompanying him, denies fever, nausea, and vomiting. Denies other associated symptoms. catheter dressing in the right femoral vein was secreting. [person] evolved during hospitalization with a diagnosis of bloodstream infection by staphylococcus aureus mrsa, complicated by l2l4 spondylodiscitis, mitral valve infective endocarditis, and ileopsoas muscle abscess. Catheter removed on 11/08 and antibiotic therapy guided by vancomycin culture was started on 11/08. Abscess in psoas was not approached due to interposition of bowel loops in an attempt at percutaneous drainage by the {organization} on 12/02. Comparative radiological improvement was observed in axial lesions and conservative treatment was maintained regarding foci of infection identified during hospitalization. [person] remained afebrile with successively negative blood cultures. As a complication associated with immobility, he developed sacral pressure injury, treated with surgical debridement and local measures. Injury care guidelines were provided by the team. He evolved with the need for hemodialysis on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays due to arteriovenous fistula in the left upper limb, but local stenosis was noted. He is currently on renal replacement therapy. good general condition, pale 1/4, hydrated, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile to the touch and eupneic in room air. neurology: conscious and oriented in time, space and person. respiratory auscultation: bilateral vesicular breath sounds with discreet bibasilar crackles, no signs of respiratory distress. cardiac auscultation: irregular heart rhythm, with normal sound sounds, no murmurs. abdomen: protuberant, bowel sounds, normotensive, painless on superficial or deep palpation, no signs of peritoneal irritation. warm and well perfused extremities. upper limbs: fistula in the left upper limb with present thrill. lower limbs: presence of discreet edema and anterior tibial ochre dermatitis. nuclear magnetic resonance 25/10/2020: intramuscular collection in the left ileopsoas 15 x 2.1 x 1.8 cm with edema and post-contrast enhancement adjacent cultures: catheter tip 11/08: vancomycin-sensitive staphylococcus aureus blood culture 11/08: staphylococcus aureus sg catheter 11/08 staphylococcus aureus blood culture 11/11: staphylococcus aureus oxa r in 2 samples blood culture 11/21: citrobacter koseri 1 sample staphylococcus aureus 1 sample blood culture 11/24: staphylococcus capitis blood culture 11/28: negative blood culture 12/01: negative blood culture 12/02: negative. attempted percutaneous abscess question: నేను ఎన్నిసార్లు అనారోగ్యానికి గురయ్యాను?
answer: అతనికి స్టెఫిలోకాకస్ ఆరియస్, MRSA వల్ల రక్తంలో ఇన్ఫెక్షన్ వచ్చింది, అది ఎంత తీవ్రంగా ఉందంటే, అతనికి వెన్నెముక స్పాండిలోఆర్థ్రోపతి, వాల్యులర్ ఎండోకార్డిటిస్ మరియు వాంతులు వచ్చాయి.

question: అతను తన నోరు ఎందుకు అంత పెద్దదిగా, దుర్వాసనతో చేశాడు అంటే నేను నీళ్ళు తాగలేకపోయాను.
answer: ఫిబ్రవరి 12, 2020న, మీరు దాడి చేయడానికి చేసిన ప్రయత్నం విఫలమైంది, ఎందుకంటే కొండల మధ్యలో భూమి అదృశ్యమైంది, అంటే మీ అంతర్గత అవయవాలు ఇంకా చెక్కుచెదరకుండా ఉన్నాయి.

question: నేను మందు కొనాలా?
answer: మీరు ప్రతిరోజూ 0.5 గ్రాముల వాంకోమైసిన్ తీసుకోవాలి, కానీ 2021 జనవరి 10 వరకు రక్త శుద్ధి అవసరం. మీరు మొదట ఎక్కువ కాలం మందులు తీసుకోవాలి.

question: అతను ఉన్నాడా?
answer: అతనికి మళ్ళీ వ్యాధి తిరగబెట్టలేదు మరియు నవంబర్ 28 నుండి ఉపశమనంలో ఉన్నాడు. అతని గాయాలు కూడా స్వల్ప రేడియోలాజికల్ అభివృద్ధిని కలిగి ఉన్నాయి.

question: నా డయాలసిస్ ఫిస్టులా నాకు ఎలాంటి సమస్యలు కలిగించదని నేను ఆశిస్తున్నాను.
answer: ఎగువ పక్కటెముకలు, మెడుల్లా మరియు సైనస్‌లలో స్టెనోసిస్ కనుగొనబడింది. స్టెనోసిస్ యొక్క పరిధిని నిర్ణయించడానికి పరీక్ష అవసరం.

discharge_summary: 1. bloodstream infection associated with Schilley catheter in the right femoral vein sac 11/08 2. bacterial endocarditis associated with catheter echocardiogram 11/18: presence of vegetation in the mitral valve 3. pyogenic spondylodiscitis in l3/l4 11/05: low back pain, gait disturbance, computed tomography of the lumbosacral spine 11/12: findings suggestive of a fracture due to bone fragility of the vertebral body of l1, gas foci in the spinal canal at the level of l2l3 that may be related to an extruded disc herniation with degenerative disc disease, and an infectious or inflammatory process cannot be ruled out, lumbar magnetic resonance imaging 25/11/2020: infectious spondylodiscitis with anterior epidural abscess 4. left ileopsoas abscess, magnetic resonance imaging 25/10/2020: intramuscular collection in the ileopsoas left 15 x 2.1 x 1.8 cm with edema and adjacent post-contrast enhancement. admission: 11/08/2020, discharge: 01/02/2021, stay: 01 m 24 d 15 h, location: ward: ward payer: sus. [person] attends hemodialysis session with severe left lower back pain that had started 3 days ago, associated with asthenia, and altered gait. [person] who was accompanying him, denies fever, nausea, and vomiting. Denies other associated symptoms. catheter dressing in the right femoral vein was secreting. [person] evolved during hospitalization with a diagnosis of bloodstream infection by staphylococcus aureus mrsa, complicated by l2l4 spondylodiscitis, mitral valve infective endocarditis, and ileopsoas muscle abscess. Catheter removed on 11/08 and antibiotic therapy guided by vancomycin culture was started on 11/08. Abscess in psoas was not approached due to interposition of bowel loops in an attempt at percutaneous drainage by the {organization} on 12/02. Comparative radiological improvement was observed in axial lesions and conservative treatment was maintained regarding foci of infection identified during hospitalization. [person] remained afebrile with successively negative blood cultures. As a complication associated with immobility, he developed sacral pressure injury, treated with surgical debridement and local measures. Injury care guidelines were provided by the team. He evolved with the need for hemodialysis on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays due to arteriovenous fistula in the left upper limb, but local stenosis was noted. He is currently on renal replacement therapy. good general condition, pale 1/4, hydrated, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile to the touch and eupneic in room air. neurology: conscious and oriented in time, space and person. respiratory auscultation: bilateral vesicular breath sounds with discreet bibasilar crackles, no signs of respiratory distress. cardiac auscultation: irregular heart rhythm, with normal sound sounds, no murmurs. abdomen: protuberant, bowel sounds, normotensive, painless on superficial or deep palpation, no signs of peritoneal irritation. warm and well perfused extremities. upper limbs: fistula in the left upper limb with present thrill. lower limbs: presence of discreet edema and anterior tibial ochre dermatitis. nuclear magnetic resonance 25/10/2020: intramuscular collection in the left ileopsoas 15 x 2.1 x 1.8 cm with edema and post-contrast enhancement adjacent cultures: catheter tip 11/08: vancomycin-sensitive staphylococcus aureus blood culture 11/08: staphylococcus aureus sg catheter 11/08 staphylococcus aureus blood culture 11/11: staphylococcus aureus oxa r in 2 samples blood culture 11/21: citrobacter koseri 1 sample staphylococcus aureus 1 sample blood culture 11/24: staphylococcus capitis blood culture 11/28: negative blood culture 12/01: negative blood culture 12/02: negative. attempted percutaneous abscess puncture on 12/02 not performed due to interposition of intestinal loops. nuclear magnetic resonance report of the pelvis performed on 12/16. agreed with [organization] for chronic patients to attend the hemodialysis room at [organization] on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays, with transportation from the city of origin to the unit carried out by stretcher taxi {omitted}. therefore, we discharge the patient with the following pending issues: observations: administer 0.5 g of vancomycin after each scheduled hemodialysis session antibiotic therapy until 01/09/2021, completing 6 weeks after the last negative blood culture assessment of arteriovenous fistula: phlebography of arteriovenous fistula indicated assess fistulography by brachial to determine the site of stenosis and then perform phlebography or assess pre-procedure with ultrasound in the room. [person] placed on list. [organization] will contact you to schedule a treatment, as recorded in the note by the sacral pressure injury specialist team: [person]'s outpatient follow-up appointment on 16/01/2021 for pressure injury reassessment. Instructions for home care of the injury were provided. Cardiology follow-up for amyloidosis investigation: [person] missed a follow-up appointment appointment on 09/09, scheduled for 01/13 for motor rehabilitation. We are awaiting an appointment by the physiatry department at [organization] requested on 12/27. Check the nuclear magnetic resonance report of the pelvis from 12/16. Previous chronic medications were maintained. Dialysis room Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays. Amyloidosis cardiology outpatient clinic 01/13. Pressure injury surgery outpatient clinic 01/16.
question: Do I have any M.A. follow-up appointments?
answer: మీరు 13/01/2013 న కార్డియాలజీ కోసం మీ డాక్టర్‌ను సంప్రదించారు మరియు 16/01/2021 న మీ రక్తపోటు సమస్యపై ఫాలో అప్ చేశారు. మీరు మీటరును మార్చడానికి ఒక అపాయింట్‌మెంట్‌ను కూడా ఉపయోగించారు.

question: మీ క్యాటరర్ ఎన్నిసార్లు ఆలస్యంగా వచ్చాడు?
answer: అతని చేతులు రక్తంతో కప్పబడి ఉండగా, ఆగస్టు 11న స్కాల్పెల్‌తో తొలగించబడ్డాయి.

question: How can they scan our brains?
answer: నవంబర్ 18న, ఎకోకార్డియోగ్రామ్ పెరికార్డియల్ మైట్రల్ వాల్వ్ స్టెనోసిస్‌కు వ్యతిరేకంగా బాక్టీరియల్ ఎండోకార్డిటిస్‌ను చూపించింది.

discharge_summary: 1 decompensated ic bc profile? decompensated pulmonary hypertension? liver injury? chronic liver disease? awaiting transthoracic echocardiography requested on 08/11 hypervolemia with transudate-type pleural effusion ascites edema lower limbs, on electrocardiogram: axis deviated to the right, signs of right atrial overload, inactive area on lateral wall. on tomography protocol pulmonary thromboembolism: dilated right atrium and ventricle, reflux of contrast into vena cava. blood gases: chronic co2 retention pattern normal bnp for age. hypoalbuminemia thrombocytopenia tgo tgp moderate volume ascites 2 perineal and lower limb cellulitis ruled out fournier by surgical team 08/11 3 pneumonia associated with mechanical ventilation worsening of secretion ventilatory worsening fever escalated antibiotic therapy for meropenem vancomycin on 08/16 and maintained metronidazole ruled out coronavirus. Negative pcr on 08/17, x-ray with right pleural effusion. Underwent diagnostic and relief thoracentesis on 08/18. 800 ml of serohematic-colored fluid was removed; transudate 4; acute kidney injury; baseline creatinine i code; admission: 0.98; clcr: 88 ml/min; kinetic 08/18: 48 ml/min; etiology: nta secondary to sepsis? hyperna hyperk; increased creatine phosphokinase; 5; atrial fibrillation with high ventricular response secondary to septic shock and fever 40º / lidocaine? amiodarone attack started 300 mg 300 mg and maintenance 900 mg/day on 08/18; cumulative dose of amiodarone on 08/19: 1.5g. admission: 08/11/2020, discharge: 08/20/2020, stay: 09 d 02 h, location: ward, payer: sus. [person] with a history of productive cough with whitish secretion, edema in the lower limbs, and dyspnea on moderate exertion for approximately 34 months, evolving with progressive worsening of dyspnea on mild exertion and a decline in general condition for approximately 2 weeks associated with odynophagia. 1 week ago [person] began to experience edema, hyperemia, heat, and pain in the genital region extending to the lower abdomen. He was taken to the emergency care unit and started on ceftriaxone 2 g/day d1 08/06 and later referred to [organization], where he was intubated due to acute respiratory failure. He was transferred to {organization} via advanced life support ambulance, intubated, hemodynamically stable, using dobutamine 20 ml/h and sedative and analgesia with fentanyl, midazolam and atracurium. No history of fever, rhinorrhea, sneezing, fever or other complaints. Serious general condition, flushed, hydrated, acyanotic, anicteric, feverish RAS4 pupils isomiotic respiratory auscultation vesicular breath sounds, reduced globally, with crackles in bases cardiac auscultation: 2 arrhythmic and normophonetic sounds in 2t without murmurs globular abdomen, normal bowel sounds, normotensive presence of sacral pressure injury. Heat in lower limbs legs bilaterally associated with edema. no signs of deep vein thrombosis genitalia with edema in penis and scrotum, associated with hyperemia and ulcer of approximately 1.5 cm in the foreskin of the bottom pustular lesion on the back, scaly cold and poorly perfused extremities. no surgeries performed. no pending exams. [person] evolved to death. discharged death.
question: మీరు I.U.D.M. ని ఎప్పుడు పంపారు?
answer: He was on a respirator and died of acute pneumonia.

question: నా పురుష శరీరంలో మరియు నాలుకలో ఏ వ్యాధులు ఉన్నాయి?
answer: మీకు 'పీరియాడిక్ అండ్ మేజర్ కాంపోనెంట్ సెల్యులైటిస్' ఉంది. మీకు 'పైన్ మరియు బల్బ్స్‌తో సంబంధం ఉన్న వాపు, హైపర్‌మియా మరియు అల్సర్' ఉంది.

question: కాటిన్, మీరు ఏ సమస్య గురించి మాట్లాడుతున్నారు?
answer: The X-rays showed "partial pulmonary infarction" and "partial pleural effusion", and "multiple pneumonias". Breathing was very difficult, and there was a "wheezing" sound at the end of each breath.

discharge_summary: coronavirus . admission: 2020-03-15, discharge: 2020-05-11, stay: 01 m 25 d 17 h, location: ward, payer: sus. id: [person], 59 years old, from [address] patient admitted on 2020-03-15 to the emergency unit of [organization] due to severe acute respiratory syndrome caused by coronavirus. patient in need of orotracheal intubation since 2020-03-17 with progression to tracheostomy on 2020-04-08. evolved with improvement in respiratory parameters being decannulated on 2020-05-08, remaining without tracheostomy, without respiratory discomfort, only with occlusive dressing. presented several complications during hospitalization, such as: 1 low-embolic load pulmonary thromboembolism, examination described below; 2 pulmonary septic shock with carbapenem-sensitive Acinetobacter baumannii, being treated with meropnem and polymyxin for 10 days and subsequently using tigecycline for 14 days, with improvement in the condition; 3 acute kidney injury, code 3, without the need for dialysis with subsequent reversal; 4 primary bloodstream infection secondary to Burkholderia cepacia, sensitive to ceftazidime and Bactrim. evolved with rehabilitation with motor and respiratory physiotherapy, with good tolerance and improved functionality during hospitalization. [person] without the need for oxygen therapy for more than 48 hours, with the need to consolidate treatment for bloodstream infection with oral Bactrim. opted for hospital discharge after a long period of hospitalization with improvement in the coronavirus condition and hospital complications. described below is the schedule for ending treatment for [person] after discharge. good general condition, pale 2/4, hydrated, oriented in time and space, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, eupneic heart rate: 70 oxygen saturation: 98% in room air cardiac auscultation: heart rhythm in normal S1 and S2, no murmurs, normal heart sounds, preserved capillary refill time, absence of jugular distension at 90º respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds present, no adventitious sounds, absence of use of accessory respiratory muscles abdomen: flaccid, painless, bowel sounds present and normal, tympanic to percussion, no palpable masses or palpable visceromegaly extremities: palpable peripheral pulses, well perfused extremities, absence of edema in the lower limbs, absence of signs of deep vein thrombosis neurology: Glasgow Coma Scale 15, presence of tremor postural in upper limbs. coronavirus pulmonary thromboembolism. schedule: anticoagulation for 6 months counting the start of treatment from 03/31/2020 ending on 09/31/2020 at the moment there is a need to use rivaroxaban 15 mg 12/12 h for another 7 days after discharge and subsequently use of a dose of rivaroxaban 20 mg/day until 05/07/2020. end of treatment for bloodstream infection with bactrin 2 tablets 8/8 hours for another 5 days after hospital discharge requested maintenance of respiratory and motor physiotherapy in [person's] city of origin. hospitalization exams: chest CT Angiography (CTA) 03/31: acute pulmonary thromboembolism with low embolic burden, without cor pulmonale. opacities compatible with coronavirus, severe involvement 50 - 75% with a component of organizing pneumonia and fibroreaction. cardiomegaly. Transthoracic echocardiography 07/05: ejection fraction 57%, mild dilation of the left atrium, preserved systolic performance of the right and left ventricles, without images suggestive of vegetation. discharge with follow-up in primary care. good conditions for hospital discharge.
question: మీరు ఆసుపత్రిలో ఎక్కడ ఉన్నారు?
answer: The man was admitted to the hospital on March 15, 2020 with symptoms of coronavirus, had difficulty breathing, and was under treatment (one month and 25 days).

answer: అతనికి 2020 మార్చి 17న 'ఆర్థోటిక్ చెస్ట్ ట్యూబ్' (శ్వాసనాళిక) అవసరమైంది. 2020 ఏప్రిల్ 8న, అతని శ్వాస మెరుగుపడింది మరియు అతని ట్రాకియోస్టోమీ 'డీక్లోరినేట్' చేయబడింది (శ్వాసనాళిక తొలగించబడింది).

Transthoracic echocardiography 07/05: ejection fraction 57%, mild dilation of the left atrium, preserved systolic performance of the right and left ventricles, without images suggestive of vegetation. discharge with follow-up in primary care. good conditions for hospital discharge.
question: నాకు కరోనావైరస్ వంటి ఏవైనా అనారోగ్యాలు ఉన్నాయా?
answer: He was admitted to the hospital for the following ailments: 1) acute embolic pulmonary embolism, 2) pulmonary septic shock, 3) acute renal infarction, 4) primary arterial infection.

question: నా ముక్కు నుండి రక్తం ఎందుకు వస్తోంది?
answer: మీరు 'పల్మనరీ థ్రోంబోలిజం' కోసం 'డాన్ డాన్ యాంటికోయాగ్యులెంట్' తీసుకోవాలి. మీరు '15 mg రోజుకు ఒకసారి, 12 mg రోజుకు ఒకసారి, 12/12 రాత్రి 7 రోజుల పాటు' తీసుకోవాలి.

question: నేను ఇంకా బ్యాక్టీరియా తినాలా (శుభ్రంగా)?
answer: నీకు బాక్టీరియా ఇన్ఫెక్షన్ చాలా తీవ్రంగా ఉంది, మీరు దానిని తీవ్రంగా పరిగణించాలి. మీరు 5 గంటల్లో ఆసుపత్రి నుండి వచ్చిన తర్వాత '2 బాక్టీరియా' మందును తీసుకోవడం ప్రారంభించాలి.

question: నేను బదిలీ చేయాలా?
answer: అతన్ని "ఆక్సిజన్ మరియు ఫార్మాస్యూటికల్ ఫిజియోథెరపీ" కోసం ఆసుపత్రికి తీసుకువెళ్లారు. డిశ్చార్జ్ తర్వాత, అతను "ఆక్సిజన్ మరియు ఫార్మాస్యూటికల్ ఫిజియోథెరపీ" కొనసాగించాలని సూచించారు.

discharge_summary: admission: 05/28/2020, discharge: 06/06/2020, stay: 09 d 04 h, location: ward, payer: sus. identification: [person], 80 years old, from [address], social worker, retired, married. problem: 1 sepsis of pulmonary focus treated with ceftriaxone d10 clarithromycin d8 pulmonary focus: productive cough flu-like symptoms fever dyspnea desaturation 6 days ago acute kidney injury kdigo 3 creat 2.14 / basal 0.68 discharged from nephrology on 06/05. hypotension requiring norepinephrine. 2 atrial fibrillation with high ventricular response 05/28 reversed amiodarone chads2vas 4. 3 urinary tract infection candida treated with fluconazole. question: మిమ్మల్ని ఆసుపత్రికి ఎందుకు తీసుకెళ్లారు?
answer: అతనికి "న్యుమోనిటిస్" అని నిర్ధారణ అయింది, ఇది ఊపిరితిత్తుల యొక్క తీవ్రమైన వాపు. అతను "ఆరు రోజుల్లో" కోలుకున్నాడు మరియు చివరికి న్యుమోనియాకు చికిత్స పొందాడు.

question: నాకు వేరే ఏవైనా అనారోగ్యాలు ఉన్నాయా?

question: ఏదైనా నా తలలోకి ఎగిరి వచ్చిందా?
answer: మే 28న, మీ 'కుడి మెదడు నిద్ర లోబ్ అతి చురుకుదనం' 'సాధారణంగా' ఉంది. మీ ఎకోకార్డియోగ్రఫీ 'కుడి మెదడు నిద్ర లోబ్‌లో స్వల్ప పెరుగుదలను' వెల్లడిస్తుంది.

answer: మీరు చాలా మెరుగుపడ్డారని చూస్తున్నాను, కానీ ఇంకా ఇతర సమస్యలతో ఇబ్బంది పడుతున్నారు (డాక్టర్)

question: ఇది 'ప్రీ-అత్తర్' ఆ?
answer: నాకు ఆసుపత్రిలో విపరీతంగా రక్తం కారడం మొదలైంది. అది 'ఇటాలియన్ మార్చ్' మరియు 'స్టాలియా సెక్యూరిటీ' వల్ల జరిగింది.

question: నా ప్రయాణం కోసం మీ దగ్గర ఎలాంటి ప్రణాళికలు ఉన్నాయి?
answer: మీ కుటుంబ సభ్యులలో ఒకరు 6వ తేదీ ఆదివారం పశువైద్యునితో 'టెలిఫోన్ సంప్రదింపులు' జరుపుతారు. మీ కుటుంబ సభ్యులలో ఒకరు 6వ తేదీ ఆదివారం 'నియంత్రణ ఎలక్ట్రో కార్డియోగ్రామ్' కోసం ప్రయోగశాల పరీక్ష చేయించుకుంటారు.

[person] with a recent diagnosis of human immunodeficiency virus, was admitted to [organization] on 10/15 complaining of dyspnea, fatigue, fever, and cough. He began treatment for pneumocystosis and with clarithromycin and ceftriaxone for pneumonia. On 10/16, he was referred to [organization], where he continued to worsen his respiratory condition, having started treatment with ganciclovir for cytomegalovirus and with a new need for antimicrobial escalation. Even so, [person] evolved with worsening, being referred to the intensive care unit on 10/28. On 10/29, [person] developed hypotension and respiratory failure, having undergone orotracheal intubation since then. On 11/04, he presented tachyarrhythmia, and impregnation with amiodarone was started, and RIP was started due to the presence of TBTRM in the bronchial lavage with positive traces of tuberculosis. [person] continued to use vasoactive drugs, having shown no improvement even after new antimicrobial escalations and continued to present progressive clinical worsening, beginning to require hemodialysis. on 11/20 [person] began to present significant worsening of hemodynamic shock, having evolved with the need for vasoactive drugs at maximum doses, not even having tolerated the first hemodialysis session that would be performed on 11/21. despite the use of vasoactive drugs at maximum doses, [person] evolved with progressive hypotension, until on 11/23 he evolved to death. absence of cardiac electrical activity on monitor absence of pulse curve in invasive blood pressure absence of respiratory incursions absent central pulses absence of response to painful stimulus. absent corneopalpebral and photomotor reflexes. absence of cardiac electrical activity on monitor absence of pulse curve in invasive blood pressure absence of respiratory incursions absent central pulses absence of response to painful stimulus. absent corneopalpebral and photomotor reflexes. coronavirus test 10/18: negative tbtrm 11/03: traces. coronavirus test 10/18: negative tbtrm 11/03: traces. no surgeries or procedures were performed. no pending tests. no therapeutic plan or education to be carried out. [person] evolved to death. confirmed death at {omitted}.

[person] with a recent diagnosis of human immunodeficiency virus, was admitted to [organization] on 10/15 complaining of dyspnea, fatigue, fever, and cough. He began treatment for pneumocystosis and with clarithromycin and ceftriaxone for pneumonia. On 10/16, he was referred to [organization], where he continued to worsen his respiratory condition, having started treatment with ganciclovir for cytomegalovirus and with a new need for antimicrobial escalation. Even so, [person] evolved with worsening, being referred to the intensive care unit on 10/28. On 10/29, [person] developed hypotension and respiratory failure, having undergone orotracheal intubation since then. On 11/04, he presented tachyarrhythmia, and impregnation with amiodarone was started, and RIP was started due to the presence of TBTRM in the bronchial lavage with positive traces of tuberculosis. [person] continued to use vasoactive drugs, having shown no improvement even after new antimicrobial escalations and continued to present progressive clinical worsening, beginning to require hemodialysis. on 11/20 [person] began to present significant worsening of hemodynamic shock, having evolved with the need for vasoactive drugs at maximum doses, not even having tolerated the first hemodialysis session that would be performed on 11/21. despite the use of vasoactive drugs at maximum doses, [person] evolved with progressive hypotension, until on 11/23 he evolved to death. absence of cardiac electrical activity on monitor absence of pulse curve in invasive blood pressure absence of respiratory incursions absent central pulses absence of response to painful stimulus. absent corneopalpebral and photomotor reflexes. absence of cardiac electrical activity on monitor absence of pulse curve in invasive blood pressure absence of respiratory incursins absent central pulses absence of response to painful stimulus. absent corneopalpebral and photomotor reflexes. coronavirus test 10/18: negative tbtrm 11/03: traces. coronavirus test 10/18: negative tbtrm 11/03: traces. no surgeries or procedures were performed. no pending tests. no therapeutic plan or education to be carried out. [person] evolved to death. confirmed death at {omitted}.

discharge_summary: admission: 12/11/2020, discharge: 01/23/2021, stay: 01 m 11 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus [person], 28 years old, from [address] 12/14 weight: 102 kg height: 162 cm. problem: 1 Status epilepticus secondary to pulmonary infection Phenytoin attack performed and maintenance dose of PHT increased Pb dosage maintained Dosage of other drugs LTG, TPM and CLB 2 Sepsis pulmonary focus 3 Deep vein thrombosis Right lower limb Full dose of enoxaparin started on 12/23 4 Pseudomembranous colitis Metronidazole started 12/30 01/10 5 Adrenal insufficiency secondary to sepsis Hydrocortisone 50 mg every 12h started on 12/31 Weaning started on 01/10 Previous functionality Oral diet Walked without assistance Dependent for some instrumental activities of daily living Bathing, physiological eliminations. Tests: Electroencephalogram 12/12: Mild to moderate disorganization of baseline activity due to increased slow wave content in the theta and delta bands, but with the presence of normal sleep graphoelements. There was no clinical or electrographic reactivity to nociceptive stimulation. b Record of electrographic seizures of variable duration (4 to 9 seconds), characterized by rhythmic activity in the beta range, evolving to alpha and theta ranges, associated with spike-type epileptiform paroxysms, with generalized projection, without associated clinical phenomena. There was a record of a seizure with rhythmic evolution to the delta range and of longer duration (18 seconds). Rare spike-type paroxysms were recorded, occurring isolatedly in the left frontocentral region. Clinical correlation: The findings are consistent with focal epilepsy with electrographic seizures, but do not characterize status epilepticus. electroencephalogram 12/19: marked symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to persistent rhythmic, semi-rhythmic bifrontal slowing in the delta band, at approximately 1.5 Hz, of medium amplitude, only temporarily mitigated by nociceptive stimulation; furthermore, lack and poor definition of physiological graphoelements of sleep. Upon nociceptive stimulation, there is also a triggering of generalized rhythmic epileptiform activity in the beta band, of low voltage, which evolves into an outbreak of frank epileptiform paroxysms of the spike type followed by a slow wave, also of diffuse expression, and with bifrontal accentuation of such stimulus-induced discharges, suppression of the clinical tracing follows; [person] presents only with painful facies. b Occasionally, associated with the slow waves described above, bisynchronous epileptiform paroxysms of the sharp wave type are observed, involving the anterior regions of the scalp. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with severe diffuse encephalopathy of a nonspecific nature, associated with focal and generalized interictal epileptogenesis, the latter being stimulus-induced. Electroencephalogram 12/22: a moderate symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to an increase in the content of slow waves in the theta and delta bands, in addition to a lack and poor definition of the physiological graphoelements of sleep. However, good electroencephalographic reactivity is noted in response to nociceptive stimuli, with an association with a dominant posterior rhythmic outline in the alpha band. b bursts of generalized rhythmic delta activity (grda) with bifrontal accentuation, occurring intermittently throughout the tracing during sleep, consisting of stereotyped waves in the 2.0 to 2.5 Hz band. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with moderate diffuse encephalopathy, of a nonspecific nature in relation to the previous tracing; significant improvement is noted, with mitigation of grda and suppression of stimulus-induced generalized epileptogenesis. electroencephalogram 02/01: slight symmetrical disorganization of the baseline activity due to the slowing of the dominant posterior rhythm of wakefulness, recorded at a frequency of up to 6.5 Hz, however with the presence of typical physiological graphoelements of sleep. b recording of epileptiform paroxysms of the spike and sharp wave type, with generalized projection, with anterior accentuation, occurring in rhythmic bursts of short duration of 3 to 4 seconds. the paroxysms are followed by delta waves and, occasionally, rhythmic activity in the beta range of short duration of less than 1 second, which also occurred preceding the bursts of paroxysms, as well as in an isolated episode during drowsiness. c outbreaks of generalized delta activity, with bifrontal accentuation, the same projections as the paroxysms, also occurring exclusively during sleep. note: [person] presented stereotyped cephalic lateralization and oromandibular movements during wakefulness, however, without electrographic correlation with ictal patterns. conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. the findings are compatible with diffuse encephalopathy and generalized epilepsy. computed tomography of the skull 11/12: no relevant alterations; computed tomography of the chest 11/12: no signs of an infectious process; cerebrospinal fluid 13/12: 1 cell; 0 red blood cells; glucose: 96; protein: non-reactive; chloride: 125; lactate: 1.91; transthoracic echocardiography 23/12: no signs of vegetation. no other alterations. cultures: tracheal aspirate: 12/27: enterobacter cloacae complex sensitive to meropenem 12/19: negative 12/12: staphylococcus aureus oxas resistant to clindamycin 01/07: staphylococcus epidermididis oxar blood culture: 12/27: negative so far 12/19: staphylococcus hominis 12/13: negative 01/07: 01/16: pseudomonas aeroginosas sensitive to ciprofloxacin, cephalosporin and aminoglycoside urine culture: 12/27: negative 01/07: negative venous catheter: 12/27: negative 12/19: corynebacterium sensitive to vancomycin and teicoplanin 01/09: staphylococcus epidermidis oxar cerebrospinal fluid: 12/13: micrococcus sp antibiotic therapy: current: ceftazidime d0 01/19 pseudomonas bloodstream infection. AEDC follow-up appointments: 02/02 schedule to complete antibiotic therapy directed at pseudomonas bloodstream infection: using ceftazidime d3, maintain for 7-10 days: currently clinically stable, cpr falling, last 2.5 AEDC: 02/02/22 maintain current antiepileptic drugs until follow-up appointment: phenytoin 100 mg 12/12h phenobarbital 100 mg 12/12h topiramate 100 100 200 clobazam 20 mg 8/8h lamotrigine 100 100 200 I renew prescriptions from [organization] regarding deep vein thrombosis: I prescribe rivaroxaban 20 mg/d, I provide a prescription for 6 months. I request follow-up in the network. Follow-up by physiotherapy at the CER: difficulty walking, associated with equine feet. Wheelchair, bath and diaper report: already delivered. Treatment for scabies with ivermectin was carried out on 01/17, repeat in 7 days. Regular general condition, acyanotic, anicteric, hydrated, afebrile. Cardiac auscultation: regular heart rhythm in 2t, normal sound sounds, no audible murmurs. Respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds in both hemithorax, no adventitious sounds. Globular abdomen, bowel sounds, depressed and no signs of defense. Warm extremities, capillary refill time less than 3s, free calves Glasgow 14, isochoric and photoreactive pupils, no pupillary hippus, no stigmata of crisis. Can raise all 4 limbs and hold them against gravity. Understands and obeys commands. Equine feet bilaterally.
question: రక్తం గడ్డను తీసే ప్రయత్నం చేసినప్పుడు రోగి అరుస్తున్న తీరు చూసి నాకు చిరాకేస్తుంది.
answer: ప్రత్యేకంగా, మీకు ఈ క్రింది వాటిలో ఏవైనా ఉంటే మీ ప్రమాదం పెరుగుతుంది: 1. మీకు టాక్సిక్ మెగాకోలన్ చరిత్ర ఉంటే, 2. మీకు టాక్సిక్ మయోకార్డిటిస్ చరిత్ర ఉంటే, 3. మీకు ఫస్ట్-డిగ్రీ హెరిడిటరీ థ్రోంబోసిస్ చరిత్ర ఉంటే, 4. మీకు సూడోమెంబ్రేన్ కొలిటిస్ చరిత్ర ఉంటే, మరియు 5. మీకు అడ్రినల్ ఇన్సఫిషియెన్సీతో సెప్సిస్ ఉంటే.

discharge_summary: admission: 12/11/2020, discharge: 01/23/2021, stay: 01 m 11 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus [person], 28 years old, from [address] 12/14 weight: 102 kg height: 162 cm. problem: 1 Status epilepticus secondary to pulmonary infection Phenytoin attack performed and maintenance dose of PHT increased Pb dosage maintained Dosage of other drugs LTG, TPM and CLB 2 Sepsis pulmonary focus 3 Deep vein thrombosis Right lower limb Full dose of enoxaparin started on 12/23 4 Pseudomembranous colitis Metronidazole started 12/30 01/10 5 Adrenal insufficiency secondary to sepsis Hydrocortisone 50 mg every 12h started on 12/31 Weaning started on 01/10 Previous functionality Oral diet Walked without assistance Dependent for some instrumental activities of daily living Bathing, physiological eliminations. Tests: Electroencephalogram 12/12: Mild to moderate disorganization of baseline activity due to increased slow wave content in the theta and delta bands, but with the presence of normal sleep graphoelements. There was no clinical or electrographic reactivity to nociceptive stimulation. b Record of electrographic seizures of variable duration (4 to 9 seconds), characterized by rhythmic activity in the beta range, evolving to alpha and theta ranges, associated with spike-type epileptiform paroxysms, with generalized projection, without associated clinical phenomena. There was a record of a seizure with rhythmic evolution to the delta range and of longer duration (18 seconds). Rare spike-type paroxysms were recorded, occurring isolatedly in the left frontocentral region. Clinical correlation: The findings are consistent with focal epilepsy with electrographic seizures, but do not characterize status epilepticus. electroencephalogram 12/19: marked symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to persistent rhythmic, semi-rhythmic bifrontal slowing in the delta band, at approximately 1.5 Hz, of medium amplitude, only temporarily mitigated by nociceptive stimulation; furthermore, lack and poor definition of physiological graphoelements of sleep. Upon nociceptive stimulation, there is also a triggering of generalized rhythmic epileptiform activity in the beta band, of low voltage, which evolves into an outbreak of frank epileptiform paroxysms of the spike type followed by a slow wave, also of diffuse expression, and with bifrontal accentuation of such stimulus-induced discharges, suppression of the clinical tracing follows; [person] presents only with painful facies. b Occasionally, associated with the slow waves described above, bisynchronous epileptiform paroxysms of the sharp wave type are observed, involving the anterior regions of the scalp. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with severe diffuse encephalopathy of a nonspecific nature, associated with focal and generalized interictal epileptogenesis, the latter being stimulus-induced. Electroencephalogram 12/22: a moderate symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to an increase in the content of slow waves in the theta and delta bands, in addition to a lack and poor definition of the physiological graphoelements of sleep. question: సెప్టిక్‌తో నేను యాంటీబయాటిక్స్ తీసుకోవాలా?
answer: You are giving Septazid for a bleeding infection triggered by a 'cyber' thought. The treatment lasts 7-10 days.

question: పనీర్‌తో చేసిన మందులు కూడా ఉంటాయంటే నాకు నమ్మబుద్ధి కావడం లేదు.
answer: తదుపరి అపాయింట్‌మెంట్ వరకు ప్రస్తుత యాంటిడిప్రెసెంట్ మందును తీసుకోవడం కొనసాగించండి. జాబితాలో ఇవి ఉన్నాయి: ఫెనిథురిడిన్, ఫెనిథోబార్బిటల్, టోపిరామేట్, క్లోబెంజైన్ మరియు లెమోట్రిజిన్.

question: రిబోఫ్లావిన్‌ను 6 నెలల పాటు ఎంతకాలం ఇవ్వమని సిఫార్సు చేయబడింది?
answer: 'సాజన్ ఖిన్' లో మీరు చూసిన 'గోతిక్ థ్రోంబోసిస్' (రక్తం గడ్డకట్టడం) కు ఇది రెసిపీ. రెసిపీ 'రెక్సోబన్ 20 ఎంజి/రోజు... 6 నెలలు'.

question: నేను నా భార్యని ఫిజియోథెరపిస్ట్‌ దగ్గరికి ఎందుకు తీసుకెళ్లాలి?
answer: మీరు కార్ ఫిజియోథెరపీ చేస్తున్నప్పుడు గదిలో దాన్ని చిందించకుండా చాలా జాగ్రత్తగా ఉండండి.

discharge_summary: admission: 12/11/2020, discharge: 01/23/2021, stay: 01 m 11 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus [person], 28 years old, from [address] 12/14 weight: 102 kg height: 162 cm. problem: 1 Status epilepticus secondary to pulmonary infection Phenytoin attack performed and maintenance dose of PHT increased Pb dosage maintained Dosage of other drugs LTG, TPM and CLB 2 Sepsis pulmonary focus 3 Deep vein thrombosis Right lower limb Full dose of enoxaparin started on 12/23 4 Pseudomembranous colitis Metronidazole started 12/30 01/10 5 Adrenal insufficiency secondary to sepsis Hydrocortisone 50 mg every 12h started on 12/31 Weaning started on 01/10 Previous functionality Oral diet Walked without assistance Dependent for some instrumental activities of daily living Bathing, physiological eliminations. Tests: Electroencephalogram 12/12: Mild to moderate disorganization of baseline activity due to increased slow wave content in the theta and delta bands, but with the presence of normal sleep graphoelements. There was no clinical or electrographic reactivity to nociceptive stimulation. b Record of electrographic seizures of variable duration (4 to 9 seconds), characterized by rhythmic activity in the beta range, evolving to alpha and theta ranges, associated with spike-type epileptiform paroxysms, with generalized projection, without associated clinical phenomena. There was a record of a seizure with rhythmic evolution to the delta range and of longer duration (18 seconds). Rare spike-type paroxysms were recorded, occurring isolatedly in the left frontocentral region. Clinical correlation: The findings are consistent with focal epilepsy with electrographic seizures, but do not characterize status epilepticus. electroencephalogram 12/19: marked symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to persistent rhythmic, semi-rhythmic bifrontal slowing in the delta band, at approximately 1.5 Hz, of medium amplitude, only temporarily mitigated by nociceptive stimulation; furthermore, lack and poor definition of physiological graphoelements of sleep. Upon nociceptive stimulation, there is also a triggering of generalized rhythmic epileptiform activity in the beta band, of low voltage, which evolves into an outbreak of frank epileptiform paroxysms of the spike type followed by a slow wave, also of diffuse expression, and with bifrontal accentuation of such stimulus-induced discharges, suppression of the clinical tracing follows; [person] presents only with painful facies. b Occasionally, associated with the slow waves described above, bisynchronous epileptiform paroxysms of the sharp wave type are observed, involving the anterior regions of the scalp. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with severe diffuse encephalopathy of a nonspecific nature, associated with focal and generalized interictal epileptogenesis, the latter being stimulus-induced. Electroencephalogram 12/22: a moderate symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to an increase in the content of slow waves in the theta and delta bands, in addition to a lack and poor definition of the physiological graphoelements of sleep. question: How is a cough cured?
answer: "ఏప్రిల్ 17న పర్యాటకుడికి ఐవర్‌మెక్టిన్‌తో చికిత్స చేశారు మరియు 7 రోజుల్లో మళ్లీ చికిత్స చేస్తారు" అని మేము చదివాము (అందమైన పుస్తకం)

question: నేను మెదడు స్కానింగ్ (EEG) చేయించుకున్నానా లేదా?
answer: The 19/12 EEG showed "accelerated progressive brain disease", whereas the 22/12 EEG showed "acute downward basal ganglion injury".

question: హే, నువ్వు CT స్కాన్ చేయించుకున్నావా లేదా?
answer: పుర్రె యొక్క కంప్యూటెడ్ టోమోగ్రఫీలో ముఖ్యమైన మార్పులు కనుగొనబడలేదు. గుండె యొక్క కంప్యూటెడ్ టోమోగ్రఫీలో ఎటువంటి వ్యాధి కనుగొనబడలేదు.

answer: Finally, he was "hale and hearty"; his lungs were filled with "healthy" gas, his vitality was "robust", and he was a "yoga master".

discharge_summary: admission: 02/06/2020, discharge: 12/06/2020, stay: 09 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus. discharge report [person], 31 years old, born and raised in [address], married, {omitted} at [organization]. date of admission to emergency unit 02/06, hospitalization summary: patient with no known comorbidities or addictions, with severe dry cough, pain in the left hemithorax and decline in general condition that started on 05/20, progressively worsening. sought medical help at the emergency care unit on 01/05 and 02/05 and was released with symptoms. due to persistent complaints, sought consultation with [person], when desaturation and signs of cor pulmonale were evidenced upon pocus according to information from [person]. The patient was referred to our service in poor general condition, hypotensive, with respiratory failure and using a 15 l/min non-rebreathing mask. Orotracheal intubation and intensive care were performed. Pulmonary thromboembolism was ruled out and bilateral pulmonary opacities suggestive of an infectious process were identified. Ceftriaxone, clindamycin, and clarithromycin were started on 6/3 and transitioned to piperacillin, tazobactam, and vancomycin on 6/5 due to septic shock, maintained until 6/12. Vasoactive drugs and neuromuscular blockade were maintained until 6/4. Sedation was discontinued on 6/7, when he was extubated without complications. The patient showed significant clinical, laboratory, and radiological improvements. He was discharged from hospital on 6/12, with guidance on warning signs and symptoms, prescription of symptomatic medications, and referral for follow-up at a primary health care unit. cultures: 04/06 negative urine culture 05/06/23 negative blood culture ongoing antibiotic therapy: ceftriaxone 03/06 to 05/06 clindamycin 03/06 to 05/06 clarithromycin 03/06 to 05/06 piperacillin tazobactam 05/06 to 12/06 vancomycin 05/06 to 12/06 previous devices: orotracheal tube 03 to 07/06 central venous catheter left internal jugular vein 03 to 11/06 intensive care unit: vasoactive drug 03 to 04/06 orotracheal intubation 03 to 07/06 neuromuscular blocker 03 to 04/06 sedation 03 to 07/06 personal history: denies known comorbidities denies known allergies habits: social drinker denies smoking denies drug use of illicit drugs medications in continuous use: ø. complementary exams: chest tomography 03/06 without images of pulmonary artery filling failure. bilateral consolidative opacities with air bronchograms and angiograms between pleural cavities: without effusions or thickening. warning signs and symptoms: intense pain high fever shortness of breath, rapid breathing, shortness of breath, fatigue intense cough with phlegm guidelines after discharge: follow-up in [organization], where to consider a new chest tomography for follow-up vaccination update symptomatic medications if necessary.

discharge_summary: date of admission: 10/04 on d11 of i mcbad and d5 of filgrastim d1 on 09/24 date of discharge: 11/03 reason for admission: treatment of bacterial and fungal endocarditis. admission: 10/04/2022, discharge: 11/04/2022, stay: 01 m 23 h, location: ward, payer: sus. case report: refractory multiple myeloma iga lambda a vi vcd iss without b2mgb/ds iiia diagnosis {omitted} relapse: anemia elevated iga and lambda pleural effusion with cytology 41% atypical plasma cells extramedullary plasmacytoma abdomen and pleura pleural biopsy 04/22: cells with scant eosinophilic cytoplasm and small, round, hyperchromatic nuclei at the cell periphery. ihq: strong and demarcated expression of cd 56, cd 138, and lambda plasmacytoid differentiation. kappa. ki67: 95%. diagnosis: plasmacytoma, multiple myeloma. abdominal biopsy 04/22: plasma cells infiltrating skeletal muscle tissue. frequent mitotic figures. no necrosis. ihq: cd138, cd56, lambda, kappa. pmo 04/16/21: diluted in sp. sv hypocellular. sb normocellular with preserved maturation. sm megakaryocytes absent in smear bmo 04/16: 35% cellularity. no neoplastic infiltration in the sample. tomography myeloma protocol 02/15/2022: awaiting report transthoracic echocardiography 04/22: ejection fraction 65% mild tricuspid regurgitation, psap 47. 2020 serologies: negative ecog: 1 previous chemotherapies: i vtd pace 07/31/2020 vi vtd d1 10/07/2020 to d1 03/10/2021 while awaiting krd disease progression previous therapeutic schedule krd total of xviii cycles [person]: performed v cycles, with disease progression emergence of plasmacytomas new treatment schedule, as discussed with [person] on 10/23: performance of mcbad for 2 to 2 cycles, while defining a new therapy. d1 i mcbad 09/24. examinations carried out during hospitalization: head tomography 05/10 done in the context of lowered level of consciousness, thrombocytopenia, bleeding ruled out. transthoracic echocardiography 10/08: preserved LVSD subjective s 8 pp 8 LVDD 45 it mild psap 50 mmhg rectification of the septum in the shape of a d extracardiac structure compressing the left atrium moderately depressed RVSD fac 20% transthoracic echocardiography 10/19: fe 62% LVDD 46 s 9.5 pp 9 filamentous images adhered to the atrial face measuring the largest 4 mm suggestive of mild IM vegetation, cultures: blood culture 10/04: staphylococcus mitis 2 samples blood culture 10/08: candida tropicalis sensitive to ketoconazole and amphotericin B micafungin and caspofungin not tested, blood culture 10/12: staphylococcus epidermidis 1 sample after 43 hours considered as a contaminant, antibiotic therapy used: cefepime: 10/04 10/05. escalated to 11/05 due to growth of streptococcus mittis in blood culture on 11/04 meropenem 10/05 10/20 vancomycin 10/05 11/03 micafungin 10/10 evaluation of other specialties: in medical records. I performed reassessment tests for the disease on the day of hospital discharge. I prescribe SLOK K 1 tablet every 12 hours. Please, whoever evaluates her at the blood center, checks the need to maintain replacement, advises warning signs and to contact the [organization] team if necessary. I request a purchase order for vorizonazole for secondary prophylaxis as instructed by the [organization] team. I schedule a transesophageal echocardiogram for 11/24. I leave pending tests to monitor eosinophilia and GGT changes, atrial fibrillation that, together with the rash presented after vancomycin on 10/31, raised the diagnostic hypothesis of DRESS syndrome by the dermatologist. Despite this hypothesis, [person] showed complete improvement of the rash and a decrease in the eosinophil count. Therefore, we opted for discharge due to low clinical suspicion at the time. I performed reassessment tests for the disease on the day of hospital discharge. hospitalization summary: [person] admitted on 10/04 on d11 of i mcbad d5 of [person] from [organization]. attended a consultation for clinical and laboratory evaluation after hospitalization 09/21 - 10/01. While waiting to be called for a consultation, she developed tremors and an increase in body temperature (pre-consultation temperature 35.6 during tremors 37.3). Due to neutropneic, she was admitted for treatment of febrile neutropenia with immediate initiation of cefepime. She was hospitalized from 09/21 to 10/01 due to dyspnea, when an extensive right lung lesion was identified, with extrinsic compression of the superior vena cava and right atrium. On September 24, the MCBAD regimen was initiated, but during the night of that date, he developed acute pulmonary edema (fluid overload), which resolved after noninvasive ventilation and furosemide. He remained in the intensive care unit for 3 days. He was discharged to the ward and, from there, to [address]. He underwent a control tomography on September 29, which showed complete resolution of compression and reduction of lung injury. After one day of hospitalization, on 10/05, she presented septic shock with need for vasoactive drugs and decreased level of consciousness, being referred to [organization], where she was hospitalized until 10/12. On 10/10, cultures with growth of yeast-like fungi were seen in blood culture 1 sample after 7:00 p.m. Candida tropicalis. Contacted [organization] and started on micafungin 100 mg 1x/day, as well as fungemia protocol, removal of central access and PIA devices, implantation of peripherally inserted central catheter and collection of catheter tip. In addition to abdominal and fundus ultrasound. The transthoracic echocardiogram showed no evidence of vegetations on examination. Therefore, transthoracic echocardiography was performed on 10/19 with the presence of filamentous images in the mitral valve suggestive of infectious vegetation, associated with mild mitral insufficiency, confirming the diagnostic hypothesis of bacterial and fungal endocarditis. Discussed with [person] from [organization] on 10/18, who advised to maintain micafungin because most Candida tropicalis are sensitive. Chest tomography was repeated on 10/18, showing control of multiple myeloma with extensive bone and right pleural disease, with disease stability in relation to 09/29 and pulmonary opacities including nodules, with the main suspicion of infectious alteration being septic embolism or fungal disease. In discussion with the [organization] team and rediscussed with [organization], we were advised to maintain antibiotics for 4 weeks from the start of treatment and not from the culture on 10/05/21 and antifungal for 6 weeks from 10/10/21. After the 6 weeks, repeat the echocardiogram and continue oral voriconazole for an indefinite period of time. Candida tropicalis is resistant to fluco and intermediate to voriconazole, given that there is no surgical plan for removal of vegetation of possible fungal etiology. On 10/31, the patient presented a skin rash with no hemodynamic repercussions and no warning signs. The hypothesis of Dress syndrome was raised, but [person] showed improvement on 11/4 with improvement in eosinophilia. discharged on 11/04/21, hemodynamically stable, eupneic, afebrile since 10/15, after finishing intravenous vancomycin with a schedule to follow-up appointment daily for infusion of micafungin 100 mg/day at the hospital on the scheduled end date of 11/21, as well as a scheduled follow-up appointment at [organization] for 11/08 to re-discuss the therapeutic schedule and arrange for the next lines of daratunumab chemotherapy.

question: మా అమ్మల వంశంలో ఏవైనా వ్యాధులు ఉన్నాయా?
answer: 'స్టెఫిలోకాకస్ ఆరియస్' (ఒక బాక్టీరియా) 'టైమ్ 10/04'లో కనుగొనబడింది. 'కాండిడా ట్రాపికాలిస్' (ఒక శిలీంధ్రం) 'టైమ్ 10/08'లో కనుగొనబడింది.

While waiting to be called for a consultation, she developed tremors and an increase in body temperature (pre-consultation temperature 35.6 during tremors 37.3). Due to neutropneic, she was admitted for treatment of febrile neutropenia with immediate initiation of cefepime. She was hospitalized from 09/21 to 10/01 due to dyspnea, when an extensive right lung lesion was identified, with extrinsic compression of the superior vena cava and right atrium. On September 24, the MCBAD regimen was initiated, but during the night of that date, he developed acute pulmonary edema (fluid overload), which resolved after noninvasive ventilation and furosemide. He remained in the intensive care unit for 3 days. He was discharged to the ward, and from there, to [address]. He underwent a control tomography on September 29, which showed complete resolution of compression and reduction of lung injury. After one day of hospitalization, on 10/05, she presented septic shock with need for vasoactive drugs and decreased level of consciousness, being referred to [organization], where she was hospitalized until 10/12. On 10/10, cultures with growth of yeast-like fungi were seen in blood culture 1 sample after 7:00 p.m. Candida tropicalis.
