question: అక్టోబర్ 19న కార్ల్ మార్క్స్ చేసిన ఎకోకార్డియోగ్రామ్ ఫలితం ఏమిటి?
answer: On October 19, esophageal echocardiography showed valvular regurgitation, which suggests the possibility of an infection (filament imaging), increasing the likelihood of endocarditis caused by bacteria and fungi.

question: అక్టోబర్ 5న నేను చెక్ రాసేటప్పుడు భయపడ్డాను.
answer: సెప్టిక్ షాక్ మరియు నిర్జలీకరణం కారణంగా అతన్ని మే 10న ఆసుపత్రిలో చేర్చారు, మే 12 వరకు లైఫ్ సపోర్ట్‌పై ఉంచారు.

question: నేను మందుల కోసం ఆసుపత్రికి వెళ్ళాలి.
answer: చివరిసారిగా 2021 మే 11న ఉదయం 11:21 గంటలకు ఆసుపత్రిలో కనిపించిన మెక్‌ఫాడెన్‌కు ప్రతిరోజూ 100 ఎంజి ఐఎంఎంజి ఇంట్రావీనస్‌గా ఇవ్వబడింది, ఆపై ఫాలో-అప్ సమయంలో ప్రతిరోజూ ఆపబడింది.

question: సాయి మా, నువ్వు కొత్త మందు తిన్నావా?
answer: డాక్టర్ సెలెనాను ఎక్కువ నీరు త్రాగమని సలహా ఇచ్చాడు, ఆరు వారాల తర్వాత ముస్తానియా త్రాగటం మానేశాడు.

I performed reassessment tests for the disease on the day of hospital discharge. hospitalization summary: [person] admitted on 10/04 on d11 of i mcbad d5 of [person] from [organization]. attended a consultation for clinical and laboratory evaluation after hospitalization 09/21 - 10/01. While waiting to be called for a consultation, she developed tremors and an increase in body temperature (pre-consultation temperature 35.6 during tremors 37.3). Due to neutropneic, she was admitted for treatment of febrile neutropenia with immediate initiation of cefepime. She was hospitalized from 09/21 to 10/01 due to dyspnea, when an extensive right lung lesion was identified, with extrinsic compression of the superior vena cava and right atrium. On September 24, the MCBAD regimen was initiated, but during the night of that date, he developed acute pulmonary edema (fluid overload), which resolved after noninvasive ventilation and furosemide. He remained in the intensive care unit for 3 days. He was discharged to the ward, and from there, to [address]. He underwent a control tomography on September 29, which showed complete resolution of compression and reduction of lung injury. After one day of hospitalization, on 10/05, she presented septic shock with need for vasoactive drugs and decreased level of consciousness, being referred to [organization], where she was hospitalized until 10/12. On 10/10, cultures with growth of yeast-like fungi were seen in blood culture 1 sample after 7:00 p.m. Candida tropicalis. Contacted [organization] and started on micafungin 100 mg 1x/day, as well as fungemia protocol, removal of central access and PIA devices, implantation of peripherally inserted central catheter and collection of catheter tip. In addition to abdominal and fundus ultrasound. The transthoracic echocardiogram showed no evidence of vegetations on examination. Therefore, transthoracic echocardiography was performed on 10/19 with the presence of filamentous images in the mitral valve suggestive of infectious vegetation, associated with mild mitral insufficiency, confirming the diagnostic hypothesis of bacterial and fungal endocarditis. Discussed with [person] from [organization] on 10/18, who advised to maintain micafungin because most Candida tropicalis are sensitive. Chest tomography was repeated on 10/18, showing control of multiple myeloma with extensive bone and right pleural disease, with disease stability in relation to 09/29 and pulmonary opacities including nodules, with the main suspicion of infectious alteration being septic embolism or fungal disease. In discussion with the [organization] team and rediscussed with [organization], we were advised to maintain antibiotics for 4 weeks from the start of treatment and not from the culture on 10/05/21 and antifungal for 6 weeks from 10/10/21. After the 6 weeks, repeat the echocardiogram and continue oral voriconazole for an indefinite period of time. Candida tropicalis is resistant to fluco and intermediate to voriconazole, given that there is no surgical plan for removal of vegetation of possible fungal etiology. On 10/31, the patient presented a skin rash with no hemodynamic repercussions and no warning signs. question: Is it necessary to do another heart exam?
answer: నన్ను 24వ తేదీకి బదిలీ చేయగల EOCకి బదిలీ చేస్తున్నారు. 6 వారాల వేలి చికిత్స తర్వాత, నేను మరొక EOC పొందాలని యోచిస్తున్నాను.

question: అక్టోబర్ 31 అచ్చి వియో, నేను చాలా సంతోషంగా ఉన్నాను.
answer: అక్టోబర్ 31న, మీ చర్మంపై ఒకే ఒక మచ్చను మేము గమనించాము. అది 'పొడి మచ్చ'గా పరిగణించబడింది, కానీ ఆ మచ్చ పూర్తిగా మాయమైపోయింది, మరియు ఎసినోఫిల్స్ సంఖ్య తగ్గింది. కాబట్టి, వైద్యపరంగా అనుమానం తక్కువగా ఉన్నందున, మీకు ఒక అవకాశం ఇవ్వాలని మేము నిర్ణయించుకున్నాము.

discharge_summary: admission: 09/01/2020, discharge: 09/17/2020, stay: 16 d 13 h, location: ward, payer: SUS. A 67-year-old patient with a history of overweight, smoking, and major depression was admitted on 09/01 with a perforative acute abdomen, diagnosed after examinations. On the evening of 08/31, she sought care with abdominal pain, general malaise, and dyspnea. She had undergone hysterectomy on 08/30. On 09/01, she underwent exploratory laparotomy with a finding of intestinal perforation, with a suture of the lesion and placement of a peritoneostomy. She developed severe circulatory shock, probably due to peritonitis from contamination of the abdominal cavity, and antibiotic treatment was promptly started. She was re-addressed on 09/06, where an appendectomy and abdominal wall closure were performed. On 09/07, the patient's ventilatory status began to worsen, and a chest tomography scan was performed on 09/08, revealing low-load pulmonary embolism (5%) in addition to pneumonia. A multiresistant germ was isolated in a lung culture, with specific treatment directed at the patient. Given the clinical progression, a tracheostomy was indicated due to the need for prolonged mechanical ventilation. On 09/15, {omitted} prolonged cardiopulmonary arrest was reversed after approximately 20 minutes. The patient follow-up appointmented to the intensive care unit after the procedure, with mydriatic pupils and absence of reflexes. On 09/17, a computed tomography scan of the skull was performed, revealing anoxic-ischemic encephalopathy. Tests were performed to confirm brain death, which was confirmed on {omitted}. Perforating acute abdomen. 09/01: computed tomography of the abdomen and pelvis: pneumoperitoneum, ascites, signs of peritonitis, parietal hyperalces and edema of the loops 09/01: computed tomography of the chest, pulmonary congestion, cardiomegaly, bilateral pleural effusion, opacities suggestive of an inflammatory or infectious process 09/08: computed tomography of the chest, pulmonary thromboembolism with 5% embolic burden 09/17: computed tomography of the skull. 09/01: exploratory laparotomy, sigmoid suture, creation of peritoneostomy 09/06: review, touch-ups on previous surgery with appendectomy and closure of the abdominal wall 09/15: tracheostomy 09/15: bilateral chest drainage. death.

On 09/01, she underwent exploratory laparotomy with a finding of intestinal perforation, with a suture of the lesion and placement of a peritoneostomy. She developed severe circulatory shock, probably due to peritonitis from contamination of the abdominal cavity, and antibiotic treatment was promptly started. She was re-addressed on 09/06, where an appendectomy and abdominal wall closure were performed. On 09/07, the patient's ventilatory status began to worsen, and a chest tomography scan was performed on 09/08, revealing low-load pulmonary embolism (5%) in addition to pneumonia. A multiresistant germ was isolated in a lung culture, with specific treatment directed at the patient. Given the clinical progression, a tracheostomy was indicated due to the need for prolonged mechanical ventilation. On 09/15, {omitted} prolonged cardiopulmonary arrest was reversed after approximately 20 minutes. The patient follow-up appointmented to the intensive care unit after the procedure, with mydriatic pupils and absence of reflexes. On 09/17, a computed tomography scan of the skull was performed, revealing anoxic-ischemic encephalopathy. Tests were performed to confirm brain death, which was confirmed on {omitted}. Perforating acute abdomen. 09/01: computed tomography of the abdomen and pelvis: pneumoperitoneum, ascites, signs of peritonitis, parietal hyperalces and edema of the loops 09/01: computed tomography of the chest, pulmonary congestion, cardiomegaly, bilateral pleural effusion, opacities suggestive of an inflammatory or infectious process 09/08: computed tomography of the chest, pulmonary thromboembolism with 5% embolic burden 09/17: computed tomography of the skull. 09/01: exploratory laparotomy, sigmoid suture, creation of peritoneostomy 09/06: review, touch-ups on previous surgery with appendectomy and closure of the abdominal wall 09/15: tracheostomy 09/15: bilateral chest drainage. death.
question: మన దగ్గర ఉన్న గుడ్లలో ఎలాంటి సమస్య ఉంది?
answer: 2010 జూలై 9న, అతను "ఎంత మంచిగా ఉండగలనో అంత మంచిగా" ఉన్నానని చెప్పాడు. 2010 ఆగస్టు 9న, ఒక సీటీ స్కాన్ "ప్లెవోలక్స్‌తో తేలికపాటి పల్మనరీ ఎంబోలస్"ను చూపించింది.

question: మీరు ఆసుపత్రికి వెళ్లాలని అనుకుంటున్నారా?
answer: అధికారిక నివేదికలో అతను "మలవిసర్జన" చేసినట్లు తేలింది, కానీ పోస్ట్-మార్టం నివేదికలో అతను "సహజ కారణాల వల్ల మరణించాడు" అని తేలింది.

discharge_summary: 1 severe acute respiratory syndrome, due to coronavirus. 2 new septic shock 01/14, fever hypotension, 3 acneiform eruption secondary to corticosteroid therapy, 4 pneumomediastinum airway injury? subcutaneous emphysema after depronation worsening ventilatory status, 5 new septic shock on 01/24 start of vasoactive drug, leukocytosis, 6 reactive adrenal insufficiency? hyperkalemia hyponatremia shock. admission: 01/06/2020, discharge: 03/03/2020, stay: 01 m 24 d 18 h, location: ward, payer: sus. clinical history [person] reports that he started with headache, myalgia and dry cough on 12/28, persisting with the same until 12/31, when he sought care and was prescribed prednisone, azithromycin, zinc and symptomatics. [person] started taking prescribed medications and on 02/01 he started with a fever, having performed a PCR for coronavirus with no result yet. On 03/01 he presented respiratory discomfort, having sought care on 04/01, when antibiotic therapy was changed to intravenous; the family member does not know which medication, however, there was no indication for hospital admission. [person] persisted with respiratory discomfort, having been hospitalized in the early hours of the same day. Emergency care unit report of oxygen saturation of 88% on room air, progressively worsening. He was admitted to the emergency unit on 06/01 with severe pulmonary involvement on chest x-ray, and was continued on antibiotic therapy initiated in the emergency care unit, ceftriaxone daily on 05/01 and prophylactic dexamethasone and enoxaparin initiated. He was admitted to [organization] on 07/01, requiring orotracheal intubation and central venous catheterization. He presented septic shock on 14/01, and his antibiotic regimen was changed. He remained in bed at [organization]. He developed new septic shock on 24/01, and began using fluconazole for fungal coverage. He developed pneumomediastinum on 26/01 due to airway injury, and underwent conservative treatment. He underwent tracheostomy on 29/01. He presented reactive adrenal insufficiency and acneiform rash related to corticosteroid therapy, in addition to diarrhea treated empirically with the hypothesis of pseudomembranous colitis. Acinetobacter baumanii was isolated in the tracheal aspirate, but was not treated due to the lack of clinical repercussion. He presented progressive clinical improvement and was transferred to [organization], where he remained stable. He underwent fibroscopy and was evaluated by speech therapy on 02/03, with no residual airway injury identified and a soft diet was released. He was decannulated on 03/03, remaining eupneic and in condition to be discharged. Good general condition, alert, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, Glasgow 15, oxygen saturation 94% in room air with capped tracheostomy, respiratory rate 28 inspirations per minute, muscle strength grade 4 in upper and lower limbs, regular heart rhythm in two beats, normal sound sounds without murmurs. Heart rate 76, vesicular breath sounds present, symmetrical, without adventitious sounds, without use of accessory muscles. Flaccid, flat abdomen, painless to palpation, without masses or visceromegaly. Extremities: palpable peripheral pulses, without edema, absence of swelling of the calves. Presence of pressure ulcer in the left lower limb, without signs of infection. Tracheostomy fibroscopy. I advise [person] on outpatient follow-up visits for: head and neck surgery on 03/15 speech therapy on 03/25 reassessment of diet physiatry to be scheduled I advise [person] on home care for tracheostomy orifice, diet, exercise and care. I prescribe symptomatic medications. Aminc, head and neck surgery, speech therapy, physiatry. Good general condition, slim, conscious and oriented, moving all 4 limbs actively with grade 4 muscle strength, still not able to walk alone. Tracheostomy orifice occluded with dressing and eating a soft diet. No pain complaints.
question: నేను ఆసుపత్రికి వెళ్లాలా?
answer: 'You had a coronavirus problem.' 'You had a coronavirus problem,' and 'The oxygen level at home was 88%, and it was slowly decreasing.'

question: 'నామడిస్ట్' అనే పదానికి అర్థం ఏమిటి?
answer: జనవరి 26న, ఒక మంద అడవి జంతువులు అతని వెనుక నుండి వచ్చాయి; నీటి తొట్టిని నింపిన తరువాత, జంతువులు అతనిని కొట్టడానికి తిరిగాయి.

discharge_summary: 1 severe acute respiratory syndrome, due to coronavirus. 2 new septic shock 01/14, fever hypotension, 3 acneiform eruption secondary to corticosteroid therapy, 4 pneumomediastinum airway injury? subcutaneous emphysema after depronation worsening ventilatory status, 5 new septic shock on 01/24 start of vasoactive drug, leukocytosis, 6 reactive adrenal insufficiency? hyperkalemia hyponatremia shock. admission: 01/06/2020, discharge: 03/03/2020, stay: 01 m 24 d 18 h, location: ward, payer: sus. clinical history [person] reports that he started with headache, myalgia and dry cough on 12/28, persisting with the same until 12/31, when he sought care and was prescribed prednisone, azithromycin, zinc and symptomatics. [person] started taking prescribed medications and on 02/01 he started with a fever, having performed a PCR for coronavirus with no result yet. On 03/01 he presented respiratory discomfort, having sought care on 04/01, when antibiotic therapy was changed to intravenous; the family member does not know which medication, however, there was no indication for hospital admission. [person] persisted with respiratory discomfort, having been hospitalized in the early hours of the same day. Emergency care unit report of oxygen saturation of 88% on room air, progressively worsening. He was admitted to the emergency unit on 06/01 with severe pulmonary involvement on chest x-ray, and was continued on antibiotic therapy initiated in the emergency care unit, ceftriaxone daily on 05/01 and prophylactic dexamethasone and enoxaparin initiated. He was admitted to [organization] on 07/01, requiring orotracheal intubation and central venous catheterization. He presented septic shock on 14/01, and his antibiotic regimen was changed. He remained in bed at [organization]. He developed new septic shock on 24/01, and began using fluconazole for fungal coverage. He developed pneumomediastinum on 26/01 due to airway injury, and underwent conservative treatment. He underwent tracheostomy on 29/01. He presented reactive adrenal insufficiency and acneiform rash related to corticosteroid therapy, in addition to diarrhea treated empirically with the hypothesis of pseudomembranous colitis. Acinetobacter baumanii was isolated in the tracheal aspirate, but was not treated due to the lack of clinical repercussion. He presented progressive clinical improvement and was transferred to [organization], where he remained stable. He underwent fibroscopy and was evaluated by speech therapy on 02/03, with no residual airway injury identified and a soft diet was released. He was decannulated on 03/03, remaining eupneic and in condition to be discharged. Good general condition, alert, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, Glasgow 15, oxygen saturation 94% in room air with capped tracheostomy, respiratory rate 28 inspirations per minute, muscle strength grade 4 in upper and lower limbs, regular heart rhythm in two beats, normal sound sounds without murmurs. Heart rate 76, vesicular breath sounds present, symmetrical, without adventitious sounds, without use of accessory muscles. Flaccid, flat abdomen, painless to palpation, without masses or visceromegaly. Extremities: palpable peripheral pulses, without edema, absence of swelling of the calves. Presence of pressure ulcer in the left lower limb, without signs of infection. Tracheostomy fibroscopy. I advise [person] on outpatient follow-up visits for: head and neck surgery on 03/15 speech therapy on 03/25 reassessment of diet physiatry to be scheduled I advise [person] on home care for tracheostomy orifice, diet, exercise and care. I prescribe symptomatic medications. Aminc, head and neck surgery, speech therapy, physiatry. Good general condition, slim, conscious and oriented, moving all 4 limbs actively with grade 4 muscle strength, still not able to walk alone. Tracheostomy orifice occluded with dressing and eating a soft diet. No pain complaints.
question: మా అబ్బాయి ముక్కులో ఇన్ఫెక్షన్ లేదని చెప్పారు.
answer: A male patient without symptoms was diagnosed with ascaridosis, but treatment was considered too expensive.

question: నాకు ట్రాకియోస్టమీ ఎందుకు అవసరం?
answer: అతను 'ఫైబ్రోస్కోప్' మీద ఉన్నాడు మరియు అతనికి ఎటువంటి లక్షణాలు లేవు. అతనికి 2010 మార్చి 3న డీ-ట్యూబిలేషన్ (గొట్టం తొలగింపు) జరిగింది. డిశ్చార్జ్ తరువాత, అతను 'ట్రాకియోస్టమీ'తో డ్రైనేజీ మీద ఉన్నాడు.

question: నేను ఒంటరిగా వెళ్ళొచ్చా?
answer: మీకు ఫిబ్రవరి 2 మరియు 3, 2010 తేదీలలో స్పీచ్ థెరపీ మూల్యాంకనం జరిగింది, మరియు మీరు మెత్తటి ఆహారాలు తినడం ప్రారంభించారు. మిమ్మల్ని క్షమించారు, మరియు మీరు మెత్తటి ఆహారాలు తింటున్నారు.

question: కాటిన్, నా చెవి రంధ్రంలో ఉన్న ఓపెనింగ్ బాగానే ఉందా?
answer: మీరు 'మంచి, స్థిరమైన' స్థితిలో ఉన్నారు. మీ నాడి స్థిరంగా ఉంది, ఆక్సిజన్ సంతృప్తత 94% వద్ద ఉంది. గ్లాస్గో 15, బార్. మీరు మీ చేతులు మరియు కాళ్ళతో నాల్గవ డిగ్రీ కదలికతో సురక్షితంగా కదలగలరు, కానీ స్వేచ్ఛగా కాదు.

question: యా సా తవామ్ సా తుషాను సా తవామ్ సా తుషాను సా?
answer: మీ సోదరుడి చికిత్స కోసం మీరు వెళ్ళాలి: 03/15 గాలి దెబ్బకు మాత్రమే శస్త్రచికిత్స మరియు 03/25 చికిత్స... మీరు ఫిజియోథెరపీ కోసం ఒక షెడ్యూల్ చేసుకోవాలి.

discharge_summary: 1. pneumonia, pulmonary metastasis? negative external rt pcr on 06/21 verified by surveillance on 06/23 2. syncope to be clarified neurocardiogenic? investigation suspended 3. consumptive syndrome due to duodenal papilla neoplasia. admission: 06/23/2020, discharge: 06/30/2020, stay: 07 d 05 h, location: ward, payer: sus. history of current illness admission: [person] referred from the emergency care unit, where he was hospitalized for 4 days. reports that 3 days ago he had a sudden episode of loss of consciousness, not preceded by prodromes, with follow-up appointment after a few seconds. level of consciousness without dysfunctions afterwards, without release of sphincters. reports only significant asthenia and fatigue associated. had 2 of these episodes on this day. had already had another similar syncope 20 days ago. He had several episodes of vomiting, which started 5 days ago and improved 2 days ago. His family called [organization] due to his condition. During the evaluation by the transport team, [person] reported an episode of fever (38.3 °C) and dry cough since 06/10. During hospitalization at [organization], he was given antibiotic therapy and referred [person] to our services. His syncope did not recur. He reported diarrhea for 15 days and improvement for 3 days, which is why his chemotherapy cycle was suspended. Upon admission, [person] was hemodynamically stable, breathing with a mask with a reservoir at 10 L/min, without respiratory distress, and denying any complaints at the moment. He is afebrile. Edema of the lower limbs, crackles, and reduced vesicular breath sounds on the left. [person] was pale and emaciated. No relevant results. Pleural fluid puncture and chest drain. Pneumonia, no pending tests. Antibiotic therapy: cefepime and clarithromycin. [person] evolves into death.
question: నేను ఆసుపత్రికి వెళ్లాలా?
answer: You were sent to the 'Emergency Treatment Unit'. 3 days ago, you 'suddenly fainted', you had a high fever and pain. You had a high fever (38.3 degrees Celsius) and a dry cough.

discharge_summary: 1. pneumonia, pulmonary metastasis? negative external rt pcr on 06/21 verified by surveillance on 06/23 2. syncope to be clarified neurocardiogenic? investigation suspended 3. consumptive syndrome due to duodenal papilla neoplasia. admission: 06/23/2020, discharge: 06/30/2020, stay: 07 d 05 h, location: ward, payer: sus. history of current illness admission: [person] referred from the emergency care unit, where he was hospitalized for 4 days. reports that 3 days ago he had a sudden episode of loss of consciousness, not preceded by prodromes, with follow-up appointment after a few seconds. level of consciousness without dysfunctions afterwards, without release of sphincters. reports only significant asthenia and fatigue associated. had 2 of these episodes on this day. had already had another similar syncope 20 days ago. He had several episodes of vomiting, which started 5 days ago and improved 2 days ago. His family called [organization] due to his condition. During the evaluation by the transport team, [person] reported an episode of fever (38.3 °C) and dry cough since 06/10. During hospitalization at [organization], he was given antibiotic therapy and referred [person] to our services. His syncope did not recur. He reported diarrhea for 15 days and improvement for 3 days, which is why his chemotherapy cycle was suspended. Upon admission, [person] was hemodynamically stable, breathing with a mask with a reservoir at 10 L/min, without respiratory distress, and denying any complaints at the moment. He is afebrile. Edema of the lower limbs, crackles, and reduced vesicular breath sounds on the left. [person] was pale and emaciated. No relevant results. Pleural fluid puncture and chest drain. Pneumonia, no pending tests. Antibiotic therapy: cefepime and clarithromycin. [person] evolves into death.
question: మీరు కీమోథెరపీని ఎందుకు ఆపేశారు?
answer: You said you haven't slept for 15 days. By now your cycles must have completed.

question: నాకు ఊపిరి తీసుకోవడంలో ఎందుకు ఇబ్బంది కలుగుతోంది?
answer: రక్షణ సమయంలో, అతను ఒక గిడ్డంగిలో ముసుగు ధరించి నిమిషానికి 10 లీటర్ల వేగంతో శ్వాస తీసుకుంటూ కనిపించాడు. పరీక్షలలో 'పొడి ఊపిరితిత్తులు మరియు తగ్గిన శ్వాస రేటు' ఉన్నట్లు తేలింది. అతనికి 'న్యుమోనియా' ఉందని బహిర్గతం నివేదిక పేర్కొంది.

question: నా గుండె కోసం వెతుకుతున్నది ఎవరు?
answer: అతని మరణానికి కారణం "ముక్కు సైనస్ మరియు మృదులాస్థి పాక్షికంగా కోల్పోవడం" మరియు "వెనుక వెంట్రిక్యులర్ కొవ్వు పాక్షికంగా కోల్పోవడం" అని పూర్తి నివేదిక తేల్చింది.

question: నేను ఆసుపత్రికి వెళ్లాలా?
answer: మీకు శ్వాస తీసుకోవడంలో ఇబ్బంది కలిగింది. మే 28న, ఒక "ప్రమాదంలో" మీ ఆరోగ్య సూచికలు దెబ్బతిన్నాయి, మరియు మే 29న, మీ RT-PCR పరీక్ష ఫలితం పాజిటివ్‌గా వచ్చింది.

question: ఆ తల్లికి నిజంగా వెంటిలేటర్ అవసరమా?
answer: మే 29న, మీరు కోవిడ్-19 పాజిటివ్‌గా పరీక్షించబడిన తర్వాత 'ఏరోవే ఇంట్యూబేషన్ అండ్ మెకానికల్ వెంటిలేషన్' ఆసుపత్రిలో చేరారు మరియు మీకు 'శ్వాస తీసుకోవడంలో ఇబ్బందులు' ఏర్పడ్డాయి.

question: నాకు దగ్గు వచ్చింది. దానిని 'ఉహ్' అని పిలిచారు.
answer: 2010 ఏప్రిల్ 6న, రోగిని పరీక్షించిన తరువాత, నివేదికలో "న్యుమోథొరాక్స్ మరియు ఎంప్యెమా రెండూ విస్తృతంగా ఉన్నాయి" అని పేర్కొన్నారు. అంటే ఊపిరితిత్తులు రెండూ కుప్పకూలిపోయాయి మరియు ఛాతీలో గాలి పేరుకుపోయింది.

question: మీరు నా టేప్‌ను ఎందుకు సవరించాలి?
answer: లోపల 'ఖోర్ నిమోత్రెక్స్' (ఖోర్ నిమాబంధ కుడకే) ఉంది. దీనితో పాటు 'ఖోర్ ఉచ నాలి' (ఖోర్ నాలి) కూడా పొడిగించబడింది. 2073/2074 లో 'యేత నాలి' తొలగించబడింది. ఖోర్ నాలి అలాగే ఉండిపోయింది.

question: నా ముక్కు నుండి రక్తం ఎందుకు వస్తోంది?
answer: 2019 నవంబర్ 11న, ఒక సిటి స్కాన్ రోగిలో పల్మనరీ ఎంబాలిజం వచ్చే అవకాశం 25% ఉందని వెల్లడించింది.

discharge_summary: 1. coronavirus infection onset of symptoms 02/17 orotracheal intubation 02/24 extubation 03/08 2. septic shock from pulmonary focus requiring vasoactive drug resolved: antibiotic therapy: ceftriaxone 02/23 03/02 clarithromycin 04/24 03/02 corticosteroid therapy: 02/24 03/09 3. critically ill polyneuropathy grade 2 strength upper limbs and lower limbs 4. pressure injury left lower limb grade i 5. your appointment scheduled with gynecology. on 03/24 for investigation. admission: 02/24/2020, discharge: 03/19/2020, stay: 22 d 21 h, location: ward, payer: sus. current: [person] with severe acute respiratory syndrome due to coronavirus, onset of symptoms on 02/17, requiring orotracheal intubation due to respiratory failure on 02/24, due to the possibility of associated bacterial pneumonia, antibiotic therapy with ceftriaxone and clarithromycin was performed. [person] presented satisfactory clinical evolution, and extubation was performed on 03/08, without complications. Gradual weaning of oxygen therapy was performed, and oxygen was withdrawn on 03/17, at the time comfortable in room air. Due to prolonged use of neuromuscular blocker to manage mechanical ventilation, [person] developed critically ill polyneuropathy, currently with grade II motor strength in the upper and lower limbs. He also has a pressure injury in the left lower limb, which is improving, with no signs of infection. Insulin therapy was started to manage hyperglycemia, with weaning after optimization of oral metformin. It is worth mentioning that during hospitalization [person] presented abnormal vaginal bleeding, and an appointment with gynecology was scheduled for 03/24 for investigation. Good general condition, hydrated, normal color, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile; respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds with crackles on a residual basis, without respiratory distress; cardiac auscultation: regular heart rhythm in two beats; normal sound sounds without murmurs; abdomen: innocent; extremities without edema, free calves, capillary refill time less than 3 s, ulcer on the left lower limb, grade I. therapeutic plan: I speak with [person] about the importance of performing pulmonary and motor physiotherapy to manage polyneuropathy in critically ill patients. He states that he will pay for home physiotherapy. He is referred to a basic health unit: management of hypertension and diabetes. Dressing of ulcer in the left lower limb region. I prescribe a dressing with AGE. Guidance from the nutrition team regarding the home diet. I follow-up appointment to the GEAD outpatient clinic on 04/26 for clinical reassessment. I follow-up appointment to the speech therapy outpatient clinic on 05/05. I schedule a pelvic ultrasound for 03/22 and a surgical gynecology outpatient clinic for 03/24. I investigate uterine bleeding. against reference [organization]. Good general condition, maintaining polyneuropathy in critically ill patients, with improvement in motor strength grade II.
question: నేను ఆసుపత్రికి వెళ్లాలా?
answer: He was admitted to the hospital on 24 February 2020 due to severe respiratory illness caused by the coronavirus and had a breathing tube inserted.

question: అనామోక్స్ వంటి ఏ యాంటీబయాటిక్స్ అవసరం?
answer: న్యుమోకాకల్ న్యుమోనియాకు సిఫార్సు చేయబడిన యాంటీబయాటిక్ చికిత్స సెఫ్ట్రియాక్సోన్ మరియు క్లావిథ్రోమైసిన్.

question: ఛీ! నా చేతులు, కాళ్ళు ఎందుకింత బలహీనంగా ఉన్నాయి?
answer: న్యూరోహార్మోనల్ డిప్రెసెంట్లను దీర్ఘకాలం ఉపయోగించిన తరువాత, అతను కోమాలోకి వెళ్ళాడు, దాని నుండి అతను కోలుకోలేదు.

question: నేను ముసలివాడినయ్యాక ఏం చేస్తాను?
answer: నొప్పి ఉన్న రోగులకు వారు పాలియురేతేన్ థెరపీ, ఫాస్పరస్ థెరపీ మరియు మోటార్ ఫిజియోథెరపీని సిఫార్సు చేస్తారు.

discharge_summary: 1. coronavirus infection onset of symptoms 02/17 orotracheal intubation 02/24 extubation 03/08 2. septic shock from pulmonary focus requiring vasoactive drug resolved: antibiotic therapy: ceftriaxone 02/23 03/02 clarithromycin 04/24 03/02 corticosteroid therapy: 02/24 03/09 3. critically ill polyneuropathy grade 2 strength upper limbs and lower limbs 4. pressure injury left lower limb grade i 5. your appointment scheduled with gynecology. on 03/24 for investigation. admission: 02/24/2020, discharge: 03/19/2020, stay: 22 d 21 h, location: ward, payer: sus. current: [person] with severe acute respiratory syndrome due to coronavirus, onset of symptoms on 02/17, requiring orotracheal intubation due to respiratory failure on 02/24, due to the possibility of associated bacterial pneumonia, antibiotic therapy with ceftriaxone and clarithromycin was performed. [person] presented satisfactory clinical evolution, and extubation was performed on 03/08, without complications. Gradual weaning of oxygen therapy was performed, and oxygen was withdrawn on 03/17, at the time comfortable in room air. Due to prolonged use of neuromuscular blocker to manage mechanical ventilation, [person] developed critically ill polyneuropathy, currently with grade II motor strength in the upper and lower limbs. He also has a pressure injury in the left lower limb, which is improving, with no signs of infection. Insulin therapy was started to manage hyperglycemia, with weaning after optimization of oral metformin. It is worth mentioning that during hospitalization [person] presented abnormal vaginal bleeding, and an appointment with gynecology was scheduled for 03/24 for investigation. Good general condition, hydrated, normal color, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile; respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds with crackles on a residual basis, without respiratory distress; cardiac auscultation: regular heart rhythm in two beats; normal sound sounds without murmurs; abdomen: innocent; extremities without edema, free calves, capillary refill time less than 3 s, ulcer on the left lower limb, grade I. therapeutic plan: I speak with [person] about the importance of performing pulmonary and motor physiotherapy to manage polyneuropathy in critically ill patients. He states that he will pay for home physiotherapy. He is referred to a basic health unit: management of hypertension and diabetes. Dressing of ulcer in the left lower limb region. I prescribe a dressing with AGE. Guidance from the nutrition team regarding the home diet. I follow-up appointment to the GEAD outpatient clinic on 04/26 for clinical reassessment. I follow-up appointment to the speech therapy outpatient clinic on 05/05. I schedule a pelvic ultrasound for 03/22 and a surgical gynecology outpatient clinic for 03/24. I investigate uterine bleeding. against reference [organization]. Good general condition, maintaining polyneuropathy in critically ill patients, with improvement in motor strength grade II.
question: రోగికి అదనపు ఆక్సిజన్ అవసరమా?
answer: "లేదు, ఆక్సిజన్ పెరిగింది, 17/03 ఆక్సిజన్ పెరిగింది, ఆపై ఊపిరి పీల్చుకోవడం సులభమైంది."

question: మనం దెబ్బతీసిన 'అసాధారణ రక్తం' ఏమిటి?
answer: Specifically, "[the uterus] is abnormally enlarged. You were admitted for uterine disease. [Examination] was scheduled for March 24, 2021." And "The uterus was examined by pelvic ultrasound on March 22, 2021."

question: నా కుడి చేతికి ఎన్ని గాయాలు అయ్యాయి?
answer: క్రింద మీకు 'ఉదర సంబంధిత ఒత్తిడి' గ్రేడ్ 1, క్రింద కుడివైపున, 'ఉదర సంబంధిత నడుము ఒత్తిడి, గ్రేడ్ 1' కనిపిస్తాయి. మీ మొదటి సంరక్షకుడు మీకు మొదటి సంరక్షణ యూనిట్‌లో క్రింద కుడివైపున 'ఉదర సంబంధిత నడుము డ్రెస్సర్' ఇచ్చాడు.

question: ఇన్సులిన్ నిజంగా అవసరమా?
answer: ఇన్సులిన్ థెరపీ హైపర్గ్లైసీమియాను నియంత్రణలోకి తెచ్చింది. నోటి మెట్‌ఫార్మిన్ నిలిపివేయబడింది.

answer: మీరు 'మెయిన్ హెల్త్ టీమ్'కు వెళ్లాలి ఎందుకంటే మీకు 'అధిక రక్తస్రావం మరియు వాంతులు' ఉన్నాయి, మరియు మీరు మీ దుస్తులు మార్చుకోవాలి. మీ సంభాషణ చికిత్స రుసుము 26/04, అవుట్ పేషెంట్ హాస్పిటల్ 05/05, పెల్విక్ అల్ట్రాసౌండ్ 22/03 మరియు గైనకాలజిస్ట్ అవుట్ పేషెంట్ హాస్పిటల్.

question: పురుషులు కడుపులో పుండ్లు రాకుండా ఉండాలంటే ఎలాంటి చర్యలు తీసుకోవాలి?
answer: కరోనా వైరస్ కారణంగా మీ 'విద్యా ప్రణాళిక' రద్దు చేయబడింది, అందువలన మీరు జూన్ 16, 2020 న 'నారింజ శ్వాస పరీక్ష' చేయించుకోవలసి వచ్చింది. మీకు 'న్యుమోనియా' కూడా వచ్చింది, దాని కోసం మీరు 'పరీక్ష' సమయంలో 'నారింజ శ్వాస పరీక్ష' చేయించుకోవలసి వచ్చింది.

question: మన శరీరం మంచిదా?

question: అతనికి ఇంకా వెంటిలేటర్ అవసరమా?
answer: అతను 2010/11లో తన గది బయట సాధారణంగా ప్రవర్తిస్తున్నాడు మరియు అతనితో ఎటువంటి సమస్య లేదు. అతన్ని తీసుకువెళ్ళినప్పుడు, అతను బాగానే ఉన్నాడు; లేకపోతే, ఎటువంటి సమస్య లేదు.

discharge_summary: abdominal septic shock, bloodstream septic shock. admission: 03/15/2020, discharge: 03/29/2020, stay: 14 days 02 hours, location: ward: payer: sus. 1 septic shock abdominal focus decline in general condition diarrhea decreased level of consciousness onset of symptoms 03/14 orotracheal intubation on admission 03/15 due to decreased level of consciousness antibiotic therapy: meropenem din 03/15 2 atrial fibrillation [person] with irregular rhythm on admission despite no record of the comorbidity in the medical record, {person} of [person] confirms previous diagnosis of atrial fibrillation, electrocardiogram admission 03/15: atrial fibrillation 3 septic shock bloodstream 03/22: worsening of hemodynamics worsening of parameters in blood culture tests 03/22/2020: klebsiella pneumoniae. presenting complaint: decreased level of consciousness, respiratory failure, diarrhea, chest pain, history collected from [person], [person] and [person]: [person] observed a decreased level of consciousness this morning, with [person] aphasic, and presenting worsening of the basal hemiplegia. She evolved with respiratory distress, and the [organization] was called to provide assistance. at the scene, the [organization] team found blood pressure of 60x0 mmhg, non-measurable oxygen saturation, capillary refill time greater than 3 s, poorly perfused extremities, glasgow 6. 1000 ml of ringer's lactate and 500 ml of sf 0.9% were infused during transport and oxygen was administered 10 l/min via mask with reservoir. Norepinephrine 20 ml/h was started while still in the ambulance shortly before being admitted to the {organization}. [person] reports that [person] has had a progressive decline in her general health and diarrhea since yesterday, with 4 voluminous, watery bowel movements, without blood or pus, after 5 days of constipation. [person] also reports that [person] complained of chest pain this morning, but was unable to detail the characteristics of the pain. They deny fever, abdominal pain, dyspnea, cough, dysuria, nausea, vomiting, or other symptoms. [person] was admitted to the lower emergency unit, glasgow 9 3 1 5, with evident respiratory distress, pulse oxygen saturation not measurable, poorly perfused, capillary refill time greater than 3 s. Orotracheal intubation was performed on admission, {omitted}. Sedation with fentanyl and midazolam was initiated. Norepinephrine was maintained at 25 ml/h 0.382 mcg/kg/min. personal history: 1 systemic arterial hypertension 2 epilepsy in AEPA follow-up 3 nucleocapsular hemorrhagic stroke ich1 / sich1 on 07/01 etiology: hypertensive, clinical: right hemiparesis, deviation of the labial rhyme to the left, confusion nihss admission 17 1b.2 / 4.2 / 5d.3 / 5e.1 / 6d.3 / 6e.2 / 8.1 / 9.1 / 10.2 previous rankin: 0 computed tomography of the skull admission: intraparenchymal thalamocapsular hemorrhage 7.7 ml CT Angiography (CTA): no stenosis or significant vascular changes identified during previous hospitalization 07/01, left hemothorax with atelectasis due to fractures of the ribs t6t11 trauma prior to hospitalization resolved with thoracic drainage fracture of the left transverse process of t7 and fractures due to demineralization from t6t11 continuous use medications: enalapril 10 mg 12/12h amlodipine 10 mg hydrochlorothiazide 25 mg carbamazepine 700 mg/day phenobarbital 100 mg/day propranolol 40 mg [person] brought, but does not know how to inform the dose, laboratory tests: 03/16 hb 12.5 ht 38 leuco 22,000 plt 282,000 na 129 k 4.6 ca 1.04 cr 1.4 lact 3.7 urine routine nitrite leuco 20,000 red blood cells 3540 granular casts 03/18: hb 11.2 ht 34 leuco 15300 plt 150000 na 134 k 3.3 cr 0.88 ur 82 lactate 2.4 pcr 23.75 ldh 821 cultures: blood culture 03/15: no growth. urine culture 03/15: no growth. tracheal aspirate 03/16: no growth. blood culture 03/22: klebsiella pneumoniae. antibiotics on admission meropenem 03/15 03/16 ceftriaxone metronidazole 03/16 03/21 meropenam vancomycin 03/22 03/27 ceftazidime avibactam 03/28 03/29 imaging tests: transthoracic echocardiogram 03/17: moderate dilation of the left atrium and mild dilation of the left atrium and ventricle. markedly depressed systolic performance of the ventricles. alterations in segmental mobility of the left ventricle. moderate mitral valve insufficiency. mild pulmonary valve insufficiency. in time, late in the afternoon, I am called to evaluate [person] in a semi-intensive bed. I find [person] monitored with orotracheal intubation and mechanical ventilation with the following vital signs on the monitor: heart rate: 0 beats per minute, no electrical activity identified by the monitor and no invasive blood pressure curve on the monitor. no signal also on pulse oximetry. I perform a physical examination with absent central pulses. I perform a physical examination with absent central pulses. I proceed with a physical examination of the trunk reflex with absence of oculocephalic reflexes, absence of corneal-palpal reflex and fixed medium pupils that do not react to light, without consensual reflex. I certify death at {omitted}. surgical tracheostomy 03/27. death.
question: Oh no, do I have to go to the hospital?

question: సెప్టిక్ ట్యాంక్ నీరు ఎందుకు కారుతుంది?
answer: అతనికి "సెప్టిక్ షాక్ అబ్డోమినల్ ఫోకస్" మరియు "సెప్టిక్ షాక్ హెమటోసిస్" ఉన్నట్లు నిర్ధారణ అయింది. అతని లక్షణాలలో "సాధారణ బలహీనత, విరేచనాలు మరియు తక్కువ క్రియాటినిన్" మరియు "హెమోడైనమిక్ అస్థిరత" (ఎర్ర చారలు) ఉన్నాయి, కాబట్టి అతనికి "నోర్‌పైన్‌ఫ్రైన్" (రక్తపోటును పెంచే మందు) ఇవ్వవలసి వచ్చింది.

question: How is the functioning of the heart (echo cardiogram) shown?

question: మా నాన్న ఎక్కడ ఉన్నారు?
answer: "ఉమీర్ ఎదుర్కొన్న ఆరోగ్యపరమైన ప్రమాదాలన్నీ సహజ కారణాల వల్ల సంభవించాయని, ఇతర ప్రమాద కారకాలకు ఎటువంటి ఆధారాలు లేవని" మరణానికి గల కారణాలను వివరిస్తూ, అతను "గుండెపోటు మరియు మెదడు రక్తస్రావం" వల్ల మరణించాడని కోర్టు తీర్పునిచ్చింది.

question: "సర్జికల్ ట్రాకియోస్టమీ" (నడుము క్రింది భాగంలో ఒక రంధ్రం) చేయడానికి కారణం ఏమిటి?
answer: చివరి వాక్యంలో, "the word that was shouted" అనేది "the word that was shouted" (the word that was said) అని రాయాలి. 27/03 న "surgical tracheostomy" గురించి ప్రస్తావించారు. మీరు 15/03 న intubated చేయబడ్డారు.

discharge_summary: abdominal septic shock, bloodstream septic shock. admission: 03/15/2020, discharge: 03/29/2020, stay: 14 days 02 hours, location: ward: payer: sus. 1 septic shock abdominal focus decline in general condition diarrhea decreased level of consciousness onset of symptoms 03/14 orotracheal intubation on admission 03/15 due to decreased level of consciousness antibiotic therapy: meropenem din 03/15 2 atrial fibrillation [person] with irregular rhythm on admission despite no record of the comorbidity in the medical record, {person} of [person] confirms previous diagnosis of atrial fibrillation, electrocardiogram admission 03/15: atrial fibrillation 3 septic shock bloodstream 03/22: worsening of hemodynamics worsening of parameters in blood culture tests 03/22/2020: klebsiella pneumoniae. presenting complaint: decreased level of consciousness, respiratory failure, diarrhea, chest pain, history collected from [person], [person] and [person]: [person] observed a decreased level of consciousness this morning, with [person] aphasic, and presenting worsening of the basal hemiplegia. She evolved with respiratory distress, and the [organization] was called to provide assistance. at the scene, the [organization] team found blood pressure of 60x0 mmhg, non-measurable oxygen saturation, capillary refill time greater than 3 s, poorly perfused extremities, glasgow 6. 1000 ml of ringer's lactate and 500 ml of sf 0.9% were infused during transport and oxygen was administered 10 l/min via mask with reservoir. Norepinephrine 20 ml/h was started while still in the ambulance shortly before being admitted to the {organization}. [person] reports that [person] has had a progressive decline in her general health and diarrhea since yesterday, with 4 voluminous, watery bowel movements, without blood or pus, after 5 days of constipation. [person] also reports that [person] complained of chest pain this morning, but was unable to detail the characteristics of the pain. They deny fever, abdominal pain, dyspnea, cough, dysuria, nausea, vomiting, or other symptoms. [person] was admitted to the lower emergency unit, glasgow 9 3 1 5, with evident respiratory distress, pulse oxygen saturation not measurable, poorly perfused, capillary refill time greater than 3 s. Orotracheal intubation was performed on admission, {omitted}. Sedation with fentanyl and midazolam was initiated. Norepinephrine was maintained at 25 ml/h 0.382 mcg/kg/min. personal history: 1 systemic arterial hypertension 2 epilepsy in AEPA follow-up 3 nucleocapsular hemorrhagic stroke ich1 / sich1 on 07/01 etiology: hypertensive, clinical: right hemiparesis, deviation of the labial rhyme to the left, confusion nihss admission 17 1b.2 / 4.2 / 5d.3 / 5e.1 / 6d.3 / 6e.2 / 8.1 / 9.1 / 10.2 previous rankin: 0 computed tomography of the skull admission: intraparenchymal thalamocapsular hemorrhage 7.7 ml CT Angiography (CTA): no stenosis or significant vascular changes identified during previous hospitalization 07/01, left hemothorax with atelectasis due to fractures of the ribs t6t11 trauma prior to hospitalization resolved with thoracic drainage fracture of the left transverse process of t7 and fractures due to demineralization from t6t11 continuous use medications: enalapril 10 mg 12/12h amlodipine 10 mg hydrochlorothiazide 25 mg carbamazepine 700 mg/day phenobarbital 100 mg/day propranolol 40 mg [person] brought, but does not know how to inform the dose, laboratory tests: 03/16 hb 12.5 ht 38 leuco 22,000 plt 282,000 na 129 k 4.6 ca 1.04 cr 1.4 lact 3.7 urine routine nitrite leuco 20,000 red blood cells 3540 granular casts 03/18: hb 11.2 ht 34 leuco 15300 plt 150000 na 134 k 3.3 cr 0.88 ur 82 lactate 2.4 pcr 23.75 ldh 821 cultures: blood culture 03/15: no growth. urine culture 03/15: no growth. tracheal aspirate 03/16: no growth. blood culture 03/22: klebsiella pneumoniae. antibiotics on admission meropenem 03/15 03/16 ceftriaxone metronidazole 03/16 03/21 meropenam vancomycin 03/22 03/27 ceftazidime avibactam 03/28 03/29 imaging tests: transthoracic echocardiogram 03/17: moderate dilation of the left atrium and mild dilation of the left atrium and ventricle. markedly depressed systolic performance of the ventricles. alterations in segmental mobility of the left ventricle. moderate mitral valve insufficiency. mild pulmonary valve insufficiency. in time, late in the afternoon, I am called to evaluate [person] in a semi-intensive bed. I find [person] monitored with orotracheal intubation and mechanical ventilation with the following vital signs on the monitor: heart rate: 0 beats per minute, no electrical activity identified by the monitor and no invasive blood pressure curve on the monitor. no signal also on pulse oximetry. I perform a physical examination with absent central pulses. I perform a physical examination with absent central pulses. I proceed with a physical examination of the trunk reflex with absence of oculocephalic reflexes, absence of corneal-palpal reflex and fixed medium pupils that do not react to light, without consensual reflex. I certify death at {omitted}. surgical tracheostomy 03/27. death.
question: ఏమి ఫలితం వచ్చింది?
answer: ఒక డాక్టరును పిలిపించారు, రోగి యొక్క పల్స్ రేటు 0 గా ఉంది, మానిటర్ మీద ఎటువంటి విద్యుత్ చర్య లేదు, అడ్డంకి యొక్క సూచన లేదు, ప్రతిబింబించే ఉపరితలాలు లేవు, ప్రతిబింబించే కార్నియా లేదు మరియు ఫలితం పాజిటివ్ వచ్చింది.

discharge_summary: 1. pneumonia, pulmonary metastasis? negative external rt pcr on 06/21 verified by surveillance on 06/23 2. syncope to be clarified neurocardiogenic? investigation suspended 3. consumptive syndrome due to duodenal papilla neoplasia. admission: 06/23/2020, discharge: 06/30/2020, stay: 07 d 05 h, location: ward, payer: sus. history of current illness admission: [person] referred from the emergency care unit, where he was hospitalized for 4 days. reports that 3 days ago he had a sudden episode of loss of consciousness, not preceded by prodromes, with follow-up appointment after a few seconds. level of consciousness without dysfunctions afterwards, without release of sphincters. reports only significant asthenia and fatigue associated. had 2 of these episodes on this day. had already had another similar syncope 20 days ago. He had several episodes of vomiting, which started 5 days ago and improved 2 days ago. His family called [organization] due to his condition. During the evaluation by the transport team, [person] reported an episode of fever (38.3 °C) and dry cough since 06/10. During hospitalization at [organization], he was given antibiotic therapy and referred [person] to our services. His syncope did not recur. He reported diarrhea for 15 days and improvement for 3 days, which is why his chemotherapy cycle was suspended. Upon admission, [person] was hemodynamically stable, breathing with a mask with a reservoir at 10 L/min, without respiratory distress, and denying any complaints at the moment. He is afebrile. Edema of the lower limbs, crackles, and reduced vesicular breath sounds on the left. [person] was pale and emaciated. No relevant results. Pleural fluid puncture and chest drain. Pneumonia, no pending tests. Antibiotic therapy: cefepime and clarithromycin. [person] evolves into death.
question: నేను ఆసుపత్రికి వెళ్లాలా?
answer: అతనికి "పారాప్లేజియా, డిజిటల్ డిస్ప్నియా, హార్స్‌షూస్", "హైపోక్సేమియా", "పర్పురా" మరియు "హైపోటెన్షన్" ఉన్నట్లు నిర్ధారించబడింది.

discharge_summary: admission: 23/02/2020, discharge: 09/03/2020, stay: 14 d, location: ward, payer: sus. [person], 65 years old, born and raised in [address], widower. problem: asthenia, worsening of basal dyspnea, drowsiness, desaturation, bladder indwelling urinary catheter with pyuria, hypotension and worsening of perfusion diagnostic hypotheses: 1. mixed shock: septic of urinary focus, weaning from norepinephrine on 25/02, cardiogenic, heart failure, due to decompensated alcoholic cardiomyopathy profile, weaning from dobutamine on 03/03 started tridil 26/02 and oral vasodilators on 27/02/2020. 2. acute kidney injury kdigo 3 creatinine: 6.57 urea: 348: acute ischemic tubular necrosis secondary to infection, SCR type 1 on renal replacement therapy since 02/23/2020. cultures: blood culture 02/23/2020: carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae in 2 samples at 22 and 42 h. urine culture 02/23/2020: carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae. history: systemic arterial hypertension, hypothyroidism? chronic liver disease, active significant alcoholism, active smoking 110 pack-years, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, presumed pulmonology evaluation on 08/18. Evolution: despite the culture showing Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase, [person] showed a good clinical response to meropenem, thus concluding the use of meropenem 1000 mg 1x/day 500 mg post renal replacement therapy for 14 days dated 02/23/2020. He evolved with improvement in infectious parameters, afebrile, with no genitourinary or cardiorespiratory complaints. Latest laboratory tests: Hb: 12.4 ht: 37 platelets: 123 gb: 7.5 without deviation to the left. Undergoing follow-up with nephrology, daily hemodialysis was performed. Schedule: with completion of antibiotic therapy and maintenance of improvement in clinical parameters, discharged from [organization] on 03/09/2020. Scheduled by nephrology for follow-up on acute dialysis on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, in the first shift.
question: నాకు ఒంట్లో బాగాలేదా?
answer: 23/02/2020 మరియు 23/02/2020 నాటి మాతృ మరియు పితృ మరణాల రేట్లు "కార్బొనెటిమ్-రెసిస్టెంట్ న్యుమోనియా" (ఒక బాక్టీరియం) గా నిర్వచించబడ్డాయి.

question: మిశ్రమ టాస్ యొక్క ఉద్దేశ్యం ఏమిటి?
answer: వెనుక నివేదికలో 'చిన్న గాయం' గురించి కూడా ప్రస్తావించారు. 'మ్యూకోర్‌మైకోసిస్ ఇన్ఫెక్షన్', 'మద్యం సేవించడం వల్ల గుండె వేగం పెరగడం, కార్డియోమయోపతి (మీ గుండెకు సంబంధించినది)' గురించి కూడా ప్రస్తావించారు.

question: My creatinine level is abnormal, do I need dialysis?
answer: Your last Guruthwara result was 3' (Creatine: 6.57), which is due to 'infection'. Your Guruthwara replacement (dialysis) schedule was fixed on 2/23/2020.

question: నాకు ఎలాంటి అంతర్గత ఆరోగ్య సమస్య ఉంది?
answer: అతని డిశ్చార్జ్ తేదీలో ఇవి ఉన్నాయి: "దీర్ఘకాలిక ధమని రక్తపోటు, హైపోథైరాయిడిజం? దీర్ఘకాలిక కాలేయ వ్యాధి, ఎక్కువగా మద్యం సేవించే వ్యక్తి, 11 సంవత్సరాలుగా ఆస్తమాతో బాధపడుతున్నాడు."

discharge_summary: id: [person], 49 years old, from [address], born in {city}. admission 17/11/2020 1. severe alcoholic hepatitis with child b7 meld encephalopathy on the 9th abdominal ultrasound 11/17 hepatomegaly and diffuse increased liver echogenicity, suggestive of fatty disease. gallstones. mild splenomegaly. last alcoholic libation in mid-november 2. fever probable urinary focus urine culture 12/30/2020 multisensitive escherichia coli ceftriaxone in: 12/30/2020 complications resolved with hospitalization:. chronic diarrhea associated with alcohol. respiratory failure nosocomial pneumonia 12/07: fever, tachypnea, requiring oxygen chest tomography 12/06/2020: pulmonary opacities with an organizing pneumonia pattern that may correspond to an inflammatory or infectious process, which may present with viral pneumonia, involving 25-30% of the parenchyma. bilateral pleural effusion. severe coronary atheromatosis rapid coronavirus test 12/08/2020 negative coronavirus PCR 12/07/2020: inconclusive, orotracheal intubation for acute respiratory failure on 12/13 extubation on 12/23 performed 7 days of meropenem termination 12/15, personal history: mood disorder? systemic arterial hypertension, obesity, diabetes mellitus? dyslipidemia, epilepsy? question: లైట్ సరిగ్గా రావడంలో మీకు ఏమైనా సమస్యలు ఎదురయ్యాయా? మరియు మీరు లైట్ ఉపయోగించాల్సిన అవసరం వచ్చిందా?
answer: న్యుమోనియా కారణంగా మీకు శ్వాస తీసుకోవడంలో ఇబ్బంది ఏర్పడింది, ఆసుపత్రిలో చేరారు. మీ ఊపిరితిత్తుల యొక్క రెండవ ఎక్స్-రేలో 25-30% ఊపిరితిత్తులు కుప్పకూలినట్లు తేలింది. ఈ తీవ్రమైన సమస్య కారణంగా, మీరు 12/13 నుండి 12/23 వరకు ఇంట్యూబేషన్ (నోటి మరియు గొంతులోకి గొట్టం చొప్పించడం) చేయించుకోవలసి వచ్చింది.

answer: The underlying cause is usually an infectious process such as "pathogenesis", but aspiration pneumonia or hypoglycemia may also be a cause.

amplitude of tracing rhythms, with a higher content of slow waves in the delta range, lack of physiological graphoelements of sleep, and absence of clinical and electroencephalographic reactivity to associated encephalopathy cannot be ruled out.
question: బౌల్డ్ గ్రూప్ ఎవరికి వచ్చింది?
answer: ఓహ్, CT స్కాన్‌లో మీ గుండె మరియు మెదడులో 25% బ్లాకేజ్ ఉన్నట్లు తేలింది. మీరు నికోరిన్ అనే మందును వాడుతున్నారు, ఇది రక్తం గడ్డకట్టకుండా నిరోధించేది.

question: Can I see the report from my IEG report?
answer: మీ ఎలక్ట్రోఎన్సెఫలోగ్రామ్ (EEG) రీడింగ్ అసాధారణంగా ఉంది. ఇది 'లోతైన అసాధారణ విద్యుత్ కార్యాచరణ'ను చూపించింది, ఇది 'గాయం తర్వాత మెదడుకు జరిగిన గాయానికి' అనుగుణంగా ఉంది. అంతేకాకుండా, మెదడు యొక్క మాగ్నెటిక్ రెసోనెన్స్ ఇమేజింగ్ (MRI) స్కాన్ 'సంక్లిష్ట గాయాలను' చూపించింది.

question: ఐబీలో నా పరిస్థితి ఎలా ఉంది?
answer: మీకు 2000 సంవత్సరంలో హ్యూమన్ ఇమ్యునోడెఫిషియెన్సీ వైరస్ సోకినట్లు నిర్ధారణ అయింది. ఆగష్టు 2020లో, మీ వైరల్ లోడ్ (CV) కనుగొనబడలేదు, మరియు మీ CD4 లెక్కింపు 904.

question: నా తలనొప్పికి నేను ఎంత మందు తీసుకోవాలి?
answer: ప్రతిరోజు మీరు తీసుకునే మందులు రాత్రిపూట 250mg వాల్ప్రోయిక్ యాసిడ్ మరియు 2.5mg క్లోనాజెపామ్. మీ గత రికార్డులు మీరు మొదటిసారి 2017లో క్లోనాజెపామ్ ఉపయోగించారని చూపిస్తున్నాయి మరియు మీ మోటార్‌సైకిల్ బీమా...

discharge_summary: admission: 12/06, discharge: 12/21, stay: 14 d 11 h, location: ward, payer: sus. 1. heart failure profile c dobutamine on 12/07 and 12/08, 2. abscess in the left thigh, osteomyelitis in the pubis, fournier's syndrome, drainage on 12/03 with ultrasound and drain placement on 12/15, treatment with ceftriaxone guided by culture of abscess escherichia coli multi s colonized antibiotic therapy after shock, incision in intensive care unit on 12/17 with abundant purulent secretion, {omitted}. 3. septic shock from cutaneous urinary focus on 12/16 polymyxin d0 12/15 amikacin and vancomycin on 12/17, 4. chronic kidney disease acute dialysis by fistula on 12/16 5. cardiorespiratory arrest with pulseless electrical activity, 10 minutes after intubation report of previous bradycardia, follow-up appointment after 1 minute of cardiopulmonary resuscitation, 6. vt with pulse after cardiorespiratory arrest, effective electrical cardioversion with a shock. [person] presenting with instability in the last half hour, requiring norepinephrine elevation up to 1.5 mcg/kg/min. progresses with bradycardia, QRS widening, and worsening shock. Given the hyperkalemia even after hemodialysis, 2 ampoules of calcium gluconate and 100 ml of bicarbonate were administered, and the respiratory rate was increased on the ventilator in order to reduce pco2 and consequently k. 2 ampoules of atropine were administered without benefit. [person] progressed to asystolic cardiorespiratory arrest, {omitted} in refractory shock. I declare {omitted} dead, due to absence of central pulses, pupils in fixed mydriasis, absence of heart sounds and asytole on the monitor, as well as absence of brainstem reflexes. The body was released. I request contact with the family. I await the death certificate to be completed. Death. Drainage of Fournier's gangrene. Death.
question: నా చిన్ననాటి స్నేహితుడు అంత జబ్బు పడటం ఎలా జరిగింది?
answer: అతనికి కుడి చేతిలో ఒక పుండు ఉంది, మరియు అతను STW మరియు క్రోన్'స్ వ్యాధితో బాధపడుతున్నాడు. పుండు ఎస్కరికా కోలికి అనుకూలంగా ఉందని కనుగొనబడింది. అతనికి సెప్టిక్ చర్మ మరియు మూత్ర మార్గము అంటువ్యాధులు ఉన్నాయని అనుమానించారు.

question: Or is it not a symptom?
answer: హే, అతను ఊపిరి తీసుకోవడానికి ఇబ్బంది పడుతున్నాడని నువ్వు ఆశ్చర్యపోయావు. మొదట, అతనికి నార్ఎపినెఫ్రిన్ ఇచ్చిన తర్వాత బాధగా అనిపించింది, తరువాత అతనికి బ్రాడీకార్డియా (గుండె దడ) మరియు పెద్ద స్ట్రోక్ వచ్చింది. ఆ మందును ఉపయోగించిన తరువాత, అతనికి ఇస్కీమిక్ గుండె జబ్బు మరియు శ్వాస సమస్యలను కలిగించే స్ట్రోక్ వచ్చింది.

question: అతని ప్రాణం ఎలా, ఏ ఆపరేషన్ ద్వారా రక్షించబడింది?
answer: మరుసటి ఉదయం, అతనికి నోర్‌పైన్‌ఫ్రైన్ ఇవ్వబడింది, కానీ అతని పరిస్థితి మరింత దిగజారింది మరియు అతనికి కాల్షియం గ్లూకోనేట్, బైకార్బోనేట్ ఆఫ్ సోడా మరియు అట్రోపిన్ ఇవ్వబడ్డాయి, కానీ ఉపశమనం కలగలేదు.

question: మీరు ఇన్ఫెక్షన్ గురించి ఏదైనా విన్నారా?
answer: ఆ వ్యక్తి కడుపు తెరవబడింది, దానిలోని పదార్థాలు తొలగించబడ్డాయి మరియు కడుపులోని ఖాళీని ఖాళీ చేశారు. ఫలితంగా, ఉదర కుహరం ఖాళీ చేయబడింది. ఆ వ్యక్తికి సెఫ్ట్రియాక్సోన్, పాలిమిక్సిన్, అమికాసిన్ మరియు వాంకోమైసిన్ వంటి యాంటీబయాటిక్స్‌తో చికిత్స చేశారు.

question: ఓడ కెప్టెన్ తన భార్యకు కీ వెస్ట్‌లో విడాకులు ఇచ్చాడా?
answer: అతను గుండెపోటుకు గురై "గుండె మరియు శ్వాసకోశ వైఫల్యంతో" మరణించాడు.

question: అతన్ని ఆసుపత్రికి తీసుకెళ్లాల్సిన అవసరం ఉందా? అతనికి కరోనా వైరస్ ఉందా?
answer: తలకి గాయం కావటం, పల్స్ విరిగిపోవటం, మరియు డీహైడ్రేషన్ కారణంగా మీ ఆరోగ్యం క్షీణించింది, కాబట్టి మిమ్మల్ని వేరే ఆసుపత్రికి మార్చారు. అయితే, మీ కరోనావైరస్ PCR పరీక్ష ఫలితం నెగటివ్ అని వచ్చింది.

06/01 carbapenemase-resistant klebsiella pneumoniae amikacin 1000 mg 48/48h d0 06/04/2020 polymyxin b 1,000,000 8/8 h d0 06/04/2020 metronidazole 500 mg 8/8h d0 06/06/2020 adjusted for weight and renal function 3. tetraparesis secondary to critical illness myopathy 4. diarrhea after exposure to antibiotics, clostridium toxin a/b research on 06/05/20 still without results, started metronidazole 500 mg 8/8h at midnight on 06/06/20, personal history: recent hospitalization 04/05 23/05: severe acute respiratory syndrome secondary to community-acquired pneumonia? 2 negative coronavirus and influenza pcrs, critically ill myopathy, epigastric cellulitis secondary to resolved proning position, morbid obesity body mass index 54.67 kg/m2 systemic arterial hypertension, congenital divergent strabismus, marijuana user since age 13, social drinker admission weight 210 kg discharge weight 144 kg height 1.96 m. physical examination: good general condition, flushed, hydrated, anicteric, acyanotic, afebrile. lucid, oriented in time and space, glasgow 15 cardiac auscultation: regular double rhythm, normal heart sounds, no murmurs, absence of jugular distension at 45. respiratory auscultation: symmetrical expansion, vesicular breath sounds present bilaterally, no adventitious sounds, impaired pulmonary auscultation due to prominent adipose tissue; abdomen: globular, no scars, no bulging or retractions, bowel sounds present in all 4 quadrants, tympanic to percussion, painless to palpation, no visceromegaly and no palpable masses, negative sudden decompression throughout the abdomen. extremities: palpable, full and symmetrical pulses in all 4 limbs, no edema, free calves, no signs of deep vein thrombosis. skin: presence of an area of oval hyperchromia in the epigastric region, approximately 10 cm in the largest diameter, with underlying induration. presence of pressure ulcers in the inner regions of both thighs, without necrotic areas and without inflammatory signs. question: నా బరువు తగ్గింది. ఎంత తగ్గింది?
answer: అతను తన షిఫ్ట్ ప్రారంభంలో 210 కిలోల బరువు ఉండగా, ఇప్పుడు 144 కిలోల బరువు ఉన్నాడు.

question: నాకు ఎన్ని సమావేశాలు మిగిలి ఉన్నాయి?
answer: మీ తదుపరి ఎలక్ట్రోఎన్సెఫలోగ్రఫీ అపాయింట్‌మెంట్ 12/01/2020 న ఉంది, మరియు కొవ్వు సంప్రదింపుల కోసం అవుట్ పేషెంట్ సంప్రదింపులు 10/11/2020 న ఉన్నాయి. మీరు మీ ఫిజియోథెరపీ మరియు పోషకాహార బృందం సూచనలను కూడా పాటించాలి.
